Description: The Power Of A Woman Awards & Mothers Day Celebrations Celebrate the extraordinary power of women and honor the incredible mothers in our lives at The Power Of A Woman Awards & Mothers Day Celebrations. Join us on Sunday, March 10, 2024 at the magnificent De Vere Grand Connaught Rooms. Prepare to be inspired as we recognize and applaud the achievements of remarkable women who have made a significant impact in various fields. From trailblazing entrepreneurs to influential leaders, this event aims to shine a spotlight on the strength, resilience, and accomplishments of women from all walks of life. Immerse yourself in an evening filled with empowering speeches, captivating performances, and heartwarming stories that celebrate the essence of womanhood. Connect with like-minded individuals, forge new friendships, and be part of a community that believes in the power of women. As we coincide with Mother's Day, this event also serves as an opportunity to express our gratitude and appreciation for the incredible mothers who have shaped our lives. Let us come together to honor the unconditional love, sacrifices, and unwavering support that mothers provide. Don't miss this unique celebration of women's achievements and the joy of motherhood. Join us at The Power Of A Woman Awards & Mothers Day Celebrations on March 10, 2024 at De Vere Grand Connaught Rooms. We have performances on the night from the legedary Queen of Lovers Rock Carroll Thompson, Gospel's Queen Lurine Cato, UK's Prince of Soul Don'e as well confirmed special guests to present awards including Peter Andre, Charles Venn, Vanessa Feltz, Patrick Hutchinson, Ashley Walters just to name a few. The event will be hosted by the fabolus Brenda Emmanus and Fredi Nwaka. To find out more about this event and see all of the 2024 Nominees please visit www.thepowerofawomanawards.co.uk
Title: The Power Of A Woman Awards & Mothers Day Celebrations
Subtitle: Join us for a spectacular evening of glitz and glamour to celebrate all women of colour and their amazing achievements.

Refund_Policy: No Refunds
Description: The affordable way to update your wardrobe! Shop through tens of thousands of unique items and pay by weight, all just ¬£20 per kilo! We have true vintage to contemporary brands so there's sure to be something for everyone! What's stocked? Find items from the 60's onwards. We have mens, womens & childrens clothing plus shoes, bags, belts & small accessories. Find dress, skirt, blouse, shirts, coats & jacket, knitwear, sportswear, t-shirts, denim & more! We stock a huge range of brands & the occasional designer label, such as Nike, Champion, Tommy Hilfiger, Ralph Lauren, Fred Perry, Levis, Lacoste, Converse, Adidas, Puma etc, How does the price work? Everything is ¬£20 per kilo, though we price in fractions so 0.05kg is just ¬£1, we work out the exact price (no rounding up) so don't worry about hitting whole kilos! Some heavy coats are capped at a maximum of ¬£20! Shoes & bags are also maximum ¬£10 an item too. Your ticket covers the whole day so you can pop in and out as many times as you like. Under 12s are free and no ticket is needed. If you require a carer/assistant, you're welcome to bring one additional person along for free, no ticket required, just let our door team know on entry. Please note: last entry will be half an hour before the event closes. WÔªøe're a small family owned business founded in 2016, and since then we've hosted 500 kilo events across the UK from Dundee to Brighton and everywhere between! We also have high street kilo shop in Sheffield open 7 days a week!  AÔªøll our items are hand-picked by our team who travel the globe sourcing the best vintage & brands we know you all love. We even have our own on-site laundrette to freshen up most items, meaning we can provided consistently high quality, ready to wear, vintage & preloved fashion at affordable prices.
Title: Hackney's Affordable PK Pop-up - ¬£20 per kilo!
Subtitle: Most items are under ¬£20 with items to be found as low as just ¬£1! Shop true vintage & brands all just ¬£20 per kilo!

Description: Groovy man! Enjoy a Flower Power themed Mothers' Day rave with the original family rave Big Fish Little Fish at our new historic venue - Woolwich Works! World famous, award winning, Glastonbury Festival performing, family rave sensation BFLF throws the ultimate family event as they bring proper rave to families with 0-8 year olds. DJ set - UTAH SAINTS!!!! Utah Saints have been making music, DJ'ing and playing gigs around the globe since the dawn of House music. With 10 UK Top 40 hits and still playing out regularly across clubs and festivals with sets that have become the stuff of legend. For all the long term BFLF attendees - this is a 'don't miss' event. It will be Something Good. Dance through the bubbles, foam and balloons or make something on the Nifty Natty craft tables. Pop on some fancy dress, grab your toddler and head to the dancefloor. For families with 0-8 year olds but all ages welcome. Family fun for the post-rave generation of parents. Helping parents be responsibly irresponsible since 2013. Licensed bar. Optional fancy dress: Flower Power - flowers, hippie ‚ÄúReliably excellent‚Äù The Guardian ‚ÄúMagical‚Ä¶ credible music....expect some serious bangers‚Äù Time Out, ‚ÄòThe best thing we do together as a family‚Äô BFLF Regular ‚ÄòThe best day of my life‚Äô BFLF 6 year old attendee 'I delayed my c-section to come here' - heavily pregnant attendee 8 times winner Arts Council Fantastic for Families Awards, 2023 Festival Kidz Best Family Music As seen and heard on BBC tv, BBC Music Biggest Weekend, BBC News, 6 Music, Sky News, Mixmag, The Guardian, The Sunday Times, The Mirror, Resident Adviser, PopSugar, Time Out (101 Things to do with Kids in London), Evening Standard, Glastonbury Festival, Victoria & Albert Museum and National Gallery. T&Cs Parents remain responsible for their children at all times. For families with younger children (8s and under) though all ages are welcome. Adult only groups are not admitted . A max of 3 children per adult in a family. If attending as a large party (more than two families)please ensure one adult to two children minimum. If there are more than 4 adults per child in your group please email info@bigfishlittlefishevents.com for pre-approval before buying tickets. Tickets are non-refundable but can be transferred/sold on. Each member of your group must have a ticket and pre-walking infants free (but ticketed). The event will be busy with hundreds of people attending. The dancefloor is for adults and children to dance together. It is meant to create a clublike atmosphere so there are no DJ requests/birthday shout outs. Please be aware that events are standing/dancing with limited seating. There will be low lighting (no strobes) so please allow a few minutes for your eyes to adjust when entering. Each event is stewarded and risk assessed in advance. Buggies must be left in buggy park outside the event space and will not be allowed on the dance floor. A licensed bar will be open during the event but no glass is permitted. We may photograph or film small parts of the event and by entering you are giving your permission for these to be used for BFLF promotion purposes. DJ lineup may be subject to unavoidable change. BFLF sets and monitors the volume using World Health Organisation guidelines - so that is at a safe level for everyone, even the youngest babies, over the 2 hour duration of the event. Though quieter than at adult events, it is still loud enough to feel like you are at a club. Most parents do not use ear defenders on their children but if yours are particularly sensitive to noise or if you want them to nap then you might want to consider it.
Title: Big Fish Little Fish x WoolwichWorks Mother's Day FamilyRave ft Utah Saints

Description: Welcome to Ghana's Haus - Ghana's 67th Independence Weekend Finale! Join us on Sunday, March 10, 2024, at 10:00 PM GMT for a night filled with joy, celebration, and Ghanaian pride. This exciting event will be held at the vibrant Cococure Haus Stratford Restaurant, Beer Garden & Club. Get ready to immerse yourself in the rich culture and traditions of Ghana as we commemorate the 67th anniversary of Ghana's independence. Experience the lively atmosphere and indulge in the flavorsome Ghanaian cuisine, renowned for its delicious spices and unique blend of ingredients. Throughout the evening, you'll be treated to electrifying live performances by talented live band, amazing all star DJs from the likes of Kwamz Original, DJ Pocks, DJ M & More! Whether you're a Ghanaian or simply someone who appreciates diverse cultures, this event is a fantastic opportunity to connect with others, make new friends, and celebrate the spirit of Ghana together. So, mark your calendars and join us at Ghana's Haus - Ghana's 67th Independence Weekend Finale for an unforgettable night of fun and unity!

Description: Mark your calendars! Got Soul brings you a one-off Sunday session at the Cottons Club. Expect to hear the best in Neo Soul, Alt R&B & Nu Jazz. Special Guest DJ from Philadelphia; DJ Junior. DJ Junior has been dropping soulful gems for some time now. Eavesdrop, his weekly radio show on WKDU 91.7FM (that he co-hosts with lil' Dave) is a staple for music heads tuning in for jazz, soul, hip hop, Latin grooves, afro-beat, broken beat, and everything in-between. In 2006, DJ Junior started Record Breakin‚Äô Music (RBM), a Philadelphia-based indie record label. They have a straightforward approach to releasing quality new music with a soulful foundation. Their focus has been and always will be to present quality music to a culture that embraces it. D J Junior is no stranger to Got Soul having played there a few times. This will be his first set with us since before the pandemic and we can't wait to have him back. Entry is FREE for the first 50 people and you can expect the usual vibes that Got Soul became known for across the globe. T IME: 6pm-11.30pm) - HAPPY HOUR: 6-8PM. DJ Junior starts at 8pm. D Js: Admission: Free (Registrations are given priority) A ttractions: Dresscode: Casual but fly. Accessibility: Please note this is a basement venue and there is no lift so unfortunately, we cannot accommodate wheelchair users. The venue is also dimly lit so please consider this if you are visually impaired. ABOUT GOT SOUL Got Soul started as a DJ centred, Neo Soul lounge brand that took place every Sunday at Juno Bar(Shoreditch) between 2009 and 2016. It then moved to South Place Hotel(Moorgate) where it ran weekly up until March of 2020 when the first covid lockdown took place. It was the perfect laid-back setting ideal for those wanting to wind down after a busy week and chill on a Sunday evening.Music policy is Neo Soul, Soul, Rare Groove, Soulful HipHop, Independent R&B & Alt R&B. Remember, this is a lounge however 2-stepping and singalongs are always welcome and expected üòâ. By attending this event, you consent to interview(s), photography, audio recording, video recording and its/their release, publication, exhibition, or reproduction to be used for news, promotional purposes, advertising, and inclusion on websites & social media.Expect to hear music from the likes of Musiq Soulchild - Sault - Erykah Badu - Anderson .Paak - The Internet - Jill Scott - Children of Zeus - Common - Brent Faiyaz - Eric Benet - Alex Isley - Minnie Riperton - D'Angelo - Robert Glasper - Gold Link - IAMDDB - Chaka Khan - J Dilla - Eric Roberson - Cleo Sol - Jazzy Jeff - Ari Lennox - Giveon - Kaytranada - Daniel Caesar - Hiatus Kiayote - Little Simz - Mac Miller - Dwele - Masego - Nao - H.E.R - Noname - Nxworries - SiR - Slum Village - Frank Ocean - Snoh Aalegra - Tiana Major9 - Syd - SZA - Tom Misch - Talib Kweli - Sam Wills - The Roots - Thunder Cat - Green Tea Peng - Moonchild & more FAQs Is my registration/ticket transferrable? Yes, it is. Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event? ID may be required as it's a licensed venue. What are my transport/parking options for getting to the event? Plenty of on-street parking. https://tfl.gov.uk/plan-a-journey/
Title: Got Soul Sundays (DJ Junior - U.S. Guest DJ) Sun 10th March
Subtitle: The UK premiere Neo Soul lounge is back in Shoreditch with a US Special guest DJ.

The Hot Girl Walk is a community and a club for you to feel part of - for those of you who just don‚Äôt fancy jumping on the Run Club trend. Along with access to our ticketed Hot Girl Walk, you‚Äôll get full access to our pop-up store - so head down early if you want to check it out, shop your wellness essentials and capture your content! Description: Meretz UK and Insaan Culture Club proudly present a unique event, bringing together Jewish, Muslim, and Arab women to explore avenues of hope amidst the challenges faced in the Middle East and Britain - not least the tragic loss of innocent lives. With speakers from Women Wage Peace, the Parents Circle, Nisa-Nashim and Basira. Date: Sunday, 10th March, 14:00-17:00 Location: The Highgate Society, 10A South Grove, London N6 6BS Distinguished Speakers: ¬∑ Ahlam Akram, Activist and Chair/Founder of Basira Arab Women's Rights Group UK ¬∑ Laura Marks, co-founder of Nissa-Nashim, a Muslim-Jewish women network. ¬∑ Alona Ferber, Senior Editor, Spotlight, New Statesman ¬∑ Peta Jones Pellach, Foreign Relations Team, Women Wage Peace (on Zoom) ¬∑ Layla Alsheikh, bereaved mother and member of the Parents Circle, Bethlehem (on Zoom). Join us for an inspiring afternoon: 2:00 pm: Music and Welcome Drinks 2:30 pm: Panel Discussion and Q&A 4:00 pm: Live Music, Networking, and Refreshments 5:00 pm: Event Concludes Exploring Hope Amidst Crisis: In a world marked by unprecedented tribulations and tragedies in Gaza and Israel, our esteemed speakers, including top British-based women leaders and those participating via Zoom from Israel and Palestine, will address pressing questions: Celebrate Unity: Set against the backdrop of The Highgate Society, our event coincides with Mothering Sunday, International Women's Week, and the commencement of Ramadan. Immerse yourself in the inviting atmosphere with music and delectable food, as we explore initiatives crafted by Jewish and Arab women despite the current crisis. Engage in Civil Discourse: Organised by Meretz UK and Insaan Culture Club, we are committed to fostering frank yet civil discussions on challenging issues. We encourage audience members to share their thoughts, feelings, and ideas, creating an enriching and inspiring afternoon during these challenging times. Ticket Information: Your ticket price will cover refreshments and the live music by leading Jewish and Arab performers. ¬∑ Price: ¬£15 (unreserved seating), concessions: 5¬£/10¬£ donation ticket. Limited seating is available due to high-calibre speakers; book early to secure your spot and avoid disappointment. We look forward to your presence at this exceptional event that promises not only insights and discussions but also hope and inspiration during these trying times. Contact: Lawrence Joffe, director of Meretz UKlrjoffe@gmail.com meretzuk@yahoo.co.uk www.meretz.org.ukwww.facebook.com/meretzuk Contact: Yasmin Whittaker Khan, director of Insaan Culture Club Insaancc@hotmail.com https://www.instagram.com/insaancultureclubhttps://www.facebook.com/insaancultureclub
Title: Bridging Hope: Women Uniting in the Middle East and Britain
Subtitle: a unique event, bringing together Jewish, Muslim, and Arab women to explore avenues of hope amidst the challenges faced in Palestine/Israel

Instrumentally diverse, they fuse the harp, harmonium, piano, and flute with electronic production and traditional kirtan meditation. üå∏‚ú® Their music envelops listeners, carrying them on a meditative voyage of sacred sound vibration. Their songs are arranged to focus audiences in yoga sound, allowing them to let go of stress and find true inner peace and tranquility.Before Twin Rivers, they were the vocalists of the indie yoga band ATMASFERA for 10 years, performing at music and yoga festivals throughout Europe and Asia. They were also the recipients of the ‚ÄúEnlightened Musician of the Year‚Äù award at the prestigious American Round Glass Music Awards in 2018. üåô ‚ú®

Description: A series of workshops with Jenny Moore Sunday 10 March 12-2pm Sunday 17 March 12-2pm - Book here Friday 12 April 10am-12pm (smaller capacity) - Book here What is it? These open workshops are a space for us to meet, connect, expand and play with the ritual of communal singing as a survival mechanism. To vibrate, vocalise, focus together, and to blow off some steam. You can expect physical and vocal warmups, quick cannons and group sonic meditations. Then, we will workshop songs from my new acclaimed choral musical, Wild Mix - a soaring 6-part song cycle with multi-layered vocals, intense beats, deeply personal and funny storytelling. Wild Mix asks: what does healing feel like? (more detail below) The invitation here is to use this music as a vehicle for channelling, connecting, sensing, moving and asking this question together. We will see what the songs do in the hands of the collective body for the first time! There will be space to reflect and share if that is friendly for you. Bring water, comfy clothes, and a curiousity for the material. Who‚Äôs it for? Open to everyone from professional singers, movers, performers, musicians & artists to anyone aching to open their mouths and sing. I‚Äôm interested in the multitudes of ways we vocalise, harmonise and fall into step and create worlds together. No experience is necessary. The Roof Studio at SDS is wheelchair accessible, warm and spacious, with natural light. (Access info below). Why? Sometimes I really do feel that I sing to stay alive. To gather myself up, to drop back into my body, and understand what‚Äôs going on in my heart and spirit, however uncomfortable. It helps me breathe deeper, or at least just breathe. It‚Äôs one of the only places I feel totally embodied ‚Äì where I can lose time, where I am less terrified. I see it as a place we can grow resilience, compassion for our own selves and safety in our own bodies. We connect to our personhood, values, loves, sorrows. I sing to be seen, to be in community, to practice vulnerability. To tell the truth. This is rooted in my own story as the founder and co-creator of F*Choir ‚Äì a queer feminist community choir that meets regularly to practice embodied polyphony, working on powerful music that feels hot in the moment and supports us in our daily lives. What‚Äôs Wild Mix, the show? Wild Mix is a new musical performed by a queer choir and crew of kickboxers. We are friends, lovers, colleagues, housemates. Rooted in communal singing, kickboxing and drumming, the show is built from these embodied practices that we use in our daily lives to practice queer survival and healing- For joy. To fall in step, to align, to experiment with our bodies after trauma. We try to tell the story of a body‚Äî the stuff that gets stuck in our muscles, cells, cortisol, bones, the trauma we carry that is beyond words. The storytelling and the methodologies we use are rooted in queer community and rely on the kinship that arises from co-created embodied practice. Jenny's unique blend of experience guides Wild Mix, exploring dissociation, C-PTSD, religious, and relational trauma through intuitive polyphonic composition and alternative communal music methodologies. ‚ÄúVisceral, innovative, alive, heartbreakingly honest, queer togetherness, a few of the words to describe last night. This made me feel things.‚Äù - audience feedback Who‚Äôs Jenny Moore? Jenny is a composer, singer, drummer and live artist originally from Canada. Voice and rhythm propels her compositional work, deep-rooted somatic storytelling is at the heart of her writing and directing. This practice works from the body, rhythm, oral / aural traditions, with the theories of muscular bonding and Deep Listening, and choreographic tools for tuning, sensing and expanding music. She believes music is a social creature, ripe for political movement. Jenny arranges and writes for F*Choir, offering complex, percussive ear-worms that challenge singers to be full-body vocalists, incorporating percussive elements and expanded vocal technique. 15 years of teaching and facilitation experience support her playful and heart-felt conducting style. ‚ÄãOther projects include: London-based choral-punk ensemble Jenny Moore‚Äôs Mystic Business known for their tuned percussion, huge vocals and chanted soulful mantras, a mix of the 90's R&B and post-punk Jenny grew up with. Their debut EP, "He Earns Enough," was released on Lost Map Records in 2021, with The Piano Tapes Vol. 1, recorded live in St Barnabas, Dalston following in 2022. Her new experimental choral punk musical, Wild Mix - a queer kickboxing, drumming, singing ritual - is currently in development. She's a regular on the London DIY scene in bands like the dance-punk trio Charismatic Megafauna and Bas Jan, hosts a radio show on Soho Radio called 'Hitting Things,' and recently made her theatre debut as Composer for Robin Hood: The Legend Re-Written at Regents‚Äô Park Open Air Theatre Access and Amenities at Siobhan Davies Studios Siobhan Davies Studios is mostly accessible, with lifts to all floors. There are two accessible parking spaces available on site which can be booked in advance. Blue Badge parking is also available nearby on West Square and Garden Row (for a full map visit the Southwark Council website). Our main door is power assisted. Amenities include: * Our changing facilities and showers are not fully accessible. Our closest publicly available and fully accessible changing facility is at The Castle Centre, a leisure centre 0.3 miles away from the studios. You can find full details of their features here.
Title: Sing to Stay Alive (with Jenny Moore)
Subtitle: Communal singing as a ritual for survival

Description: We're excited to invite you to an exclusive event: Classic Margarita Masterclass! Join us for an evening of fun, flavour, and fiesta as we learn the art of crafting the perfect classic margarita. Led by our expert mixologists, you'll discover the secrets behind balancing the tangy citrus, the smooth tequila, and just the right amount of sweetness to create a margarita that will tantalise your taste buds and impress your guests. This masterclass is open to all residents of Florence Dock, as well as the wider local community. Whether you're a seasoned cocktail connoisseur or a newcomer to the world of mixology, this event promises to be a lively and enjoyable experience for all. We'll provide all the ingredients and equipment you need to shake, stir, and sip your way to margarita perfection. Space is limited and we want to ensure we have enough limes for everyone! Prepare to hone your bartending skills, mingle with fellow margarita enthusiasts, and raise a glass to good times and great company.¬† Salud! Residents' Events at Folk For 'RSVP events', please RSVP to the event by registering for a ticket. If you can‚Äôt make the event, please cancel your ticket so someone else can book in your place, although please note that tickets for a paid event are non refundable.  We'd love to hear your thoughts on our events, and tell you how you can get involved in our programme - please email any comments and feedback to folk@florencedock.com

Subtitle: The Bar

Description: After a successful collaboration on a light show event in December, The Together Space and The Social Cinema are working together again to present SHORT/CUT - a screening of short animations plus a sensory art workshop to compliment these shorts. SHORT/CUT will take place at Switchboard Studios on Sunday 10th of March. There will be two screenings: Screening 1 from 2 - 3:15pm Screening 2 from 3:45 - 5pm The animations will run throughout the session with the sensory art workshop alongside it so children can choose how they would like to enjoy the cinematic experience. Whether it be sitting and watching the animations for the whole time, trying the art workshop whilst watching or doing a bit of both at different times. List of the short films to be screened: Cat and bird (Germany, 2021) 7‚Äô36‚Äù Dir. Franka Sachse A white bird living in a black world encounters a black cat living in a white world. The moment they meet, their backgrounds literally collide. Kuap (Switzerland, 2018) 7‚Äô38‚Äù Dir. Nils Hedinger A tadpole fails to develop into a frog like and is left behind by the others. But there's so much to experience in his small pond and the next spring is just around the corner. Pond (Switzerland, 2023) 8‚Äô30‚Äù Dir. Lena von D√∂hren, Eva Rust One small herring finds itself stranded in a tidal pool. As it searches for a way out, it discovers many other sea creatures there. And now there is no need for fear: by joining forces they can defend themselves against a hungry seagull. Kiki La Plume (France, 2020) 5‚Äô47‚Äù Dir. Julie Rembauville, Nicolas Bianco-Levrin Kiki only knows her cage. Her unexpected freedom brings not only danger but also friendship, adventure and the joy of flying. *All of these shorts are certified as U except Pond, which has a PG cert. due to mild threat: the herring and its friends are threatened by a seagull in search for its lunch but join forces to scare it away.* The Social Cinema have chosen short animations without dialogue to ensure the screenings are accessible to all children attending. The programme of shorts is designed to introduce children to unusual visual styles and animation techniques that are hard to find in mainstream family entertainment. The absence of dialogue is inclusive and also encourages all children to engage with a type of storytelling that creatively relies on other forms of communication other than verbal such music, gesture and sound. The Together Space run pop-up events around Walthamstow with a mission to tackle social segregation for children and young people with SEND and their families. The aim of these events is to provide an inclusive space for both disabled and non-disabled children/young people and their families. Research shows that children with SEND (Special Educational Needs and Disability) partake in fewer activities and participate less frequently than their peers without SEND. Going to the cinema is one of these activities which is why this collaboration is so meaningful for most of the families that attend The Together Space. This is a trial event in the hope of touring to different venues around the borough later in the year.
Title: The Together Space and The Social Cinema present SHORT/CUT
Subtitle: A relaxed screening of shorts with no dialogue alongside a sensory art workshop to play with space, colour and texture.

Description: 'Create for Your Space' Series: Cactus Planting! Why cactuses, you may ask? Well, aside from their undeniable charm and low-maintenance nature, cactuses symbolise resilience and adaptability‚Äîqualities that resonate deeply within our community. By nurturing these resilient plants together, we not only enhance the aesthetic appeal of our studios but also cultivate a sense of unity and growth within Florence Dock. We warmly welcome not only the residents of Florence Dock but also our friends from Carneys and the wider local community to join us for this event. Let's come together, share our stories, and create something beautiful that will continue to thrive long after the workshop ends. Please RSVP to ensure we have enough supplies for everyone. Come one, come all, and let's green up our spaces together! Residents' Events at Folk For 'RSVP events', please RSVP to the event by registering for a ticket. If you can‚Äôt make the event, please cancel your ticket so someone else can book in your place, although please note that tickets for a paid event are non refundable. You‚Äôre always welcome to try and join us on the day, but the only way to guarantee a space is to book one. For 'Drop In events' there is no need to RSVP in order to attend, however please RSVP if you wish to receive a reminder email in advance of the event. We may charge a nominal ticket fee for some events, when either a) the event has limited capacity and we want to encourage attendance, or b) the event offers value beyond our standard events, such as a food and drink element, travel, or access to an elevated experience. All ticket revenue from the nominal fee is reinvested back into making your event programme as exciting and diverse as possible. We may take pictures at the events that will be used for marketing purposes, and that by attending you give your consent to be photographed and featured.  We'd love to hear your thoughts on our events, and tell you how you can get involved in our programme - please email any comments and feedback to folk@florencedock.com
Title: Cactus Planting Workshop at Florence Dock
Subtitle: The Bar/ Lounge

Description: üì¢CALLING ALL FIERCE YOUNG WOMEN 17-25 üì¢ ‚úÖ Please note you will get a refund upon attendance ‚úÖ Also available concessions for anyone that wants to attend but can't financially afford it Please reach out via email : shebelievesshecan@gmail.com WHY IS THIS EVENT ONLY FOR 17-25 YEAR OLD YOUNG WOMEN? As the founder of SBSC this event is close to my heart because it reflects a personal mission to empower young women during a critical stage in their lives. At the age of 17-25, I experienced homelessness and displacement firsthand, and I deeply understand the challenges and lack of support many young women face during this time. This event is my way of giving back to the community and creating a space where young women feel seen, heard, and supported. While I plan to host inclusive events for everyone in the future, this particular event is designed specifically for this age group due to my personal connection and the unique needs of young women at this stage. I believe tailoring support to specific demographics allows me to offer the most impactful and relevant resources. Why attend: Don't miss this opportunity to celebrate International Women's Day in a truly unique and empowering way! Limited spots available, so don't wait! Grab your besties or fly solo, and register now! P.S. Don't forget to tag us in your social media posts using #Fabletics #shebelievesshecan We can't wait to Celebrate with you all x If you have further enquiries please email: shebelievesshecan@gmail.com ‚úÖCONSENT By registering, you must confirm that you have obtained permission from your parent/carer to attend this event. üì∏(Separate photography/video consent): Photography and filming may occur during this event. By registering, you agree to your image or likeness being captured and used for promotional purposes. You can opt out of this by contacting us via email : shebelievesshecan@gmail.com Please don't forget tick the box at the end to confirm your agreement. About The Venue & Location Fabletics is Located in the heart of London's vibrant shopping scene, Fabletics Regent Street is your one-stop shop for all things activewear. Fabletics isn't just activewear, it's a lifestyle. Their clothes fuse trendy designs with cutting-edge tech, making them perfect for everything you do, from crushing workouts to conquering your day. Their innovative VIP membership program unlocks premium quality at accessible prices, with fresh, size-inclusive collections dropping every week for both women and men. WE NEED SPONSORS & IN KIND SUPPORT Would you like to sponsor She Believes She Can Community? Not only will you be supporting the personal development of the young women you will also be contributing to the overall wellbeing and resilience of our community. Together, we can create a positive ripple effect that will inspire and empower generations to come. We would love to hear from you please email shebelievesshecan@gmail.com
Title: FABLETICS x SHE BELIEVES SHE CAN
Subtitle: In partnership with Fabletics, join us for an empowering journey of physical movement, mindful exploration, and sisterhood to celebrate IWD

Description: Join us for a beautiful night of singing mantras, drinking cacao, and creating community. Kirtan is a practice of Bhakti Yoga - the yoga of devotion or the yoga of love and is one of the most loved, yet least known practices of yoga. Whereas in our physical yoga practice (or asana) we focus on our breath, in kirtan we allow the mantras to become the focus of our mind as we become absorbed in the sound and the meaning of the words and travel on a journey within. The evening will begin with us giving gratitude and setting intentions with a delicious cup of ceremonial cacao - an ancient plant medicine which will open our hearts and raise our frequency to that which will allow our intentions to manifest. We will then journey into our practice of mantra meditation. We will sing and chant sacred mantras, allowing space for us to ask for and recieve guidance, and connect to the divinity within ourselves, each other, and the whole world around us. Throughout the evening we will discuss the meaning of the mantras and encourage you to find your own meaning within them. This is a beautiful and powerful practice for everyone - regardless of religion or background. All of our instruments are 100% vegan. Typically, instruments used in kirtan contain leather and the dead skin of animals which we feel to be contradictory to the energies of love we wish to cultivate and the messages of peace we are trying to send into the world. We wish to extend this compassion to all beings, so all of our instruments are vegan and/or use synthetic alternatives. All of the beautiful sound with none of the suffering. The ceremonial cacao we will use is vegan, organic and sustainably sourced from Peru and helps to support indigenous communities. No knowledge or experience of kirtan is required. The mantras will be on a screen for you to read and we will discuss each of them prior to chanting. This will be a safe space to release and take what you need. Just come as you are! „Ä∞Ô∏è Sunday 10th March 7-9pm „Ä∞Ô∏è Location: Love Shack, Cambridge Heath, E2 9HA „Ä∞Ô∏è Cup of cacao included (Note: If you are on antidepressants, pregnant, have high blood pressure or any heart condition, we do not recommend you to drink the cacao. If this is the case, let us know - we can offer you an alternative) „Ä∞Ô∏è Please bring something comfy for sitting on! „Ä∞Ô∏è We invite you to bring crystals or anything with meaning to you to add to our altar and charge with beautiful energy If you have any questions, please feel free to contact Molly (@_mollyelsdon) on instagram. We can't wait to welcome you x
Title: Vegan Kirtan & Cacao
Subtitle: A beautiful night of mantra meditation, love and community, in the coolest vegan spot in London!

Description: The typical format of the session is a full stretch, a 25 minute HIIT workout and end with a full stretch. Every week will be different and sometimes the format will be completely different! There are 4 sessions in a calendar week. The Mon session will be repeated Tue, Thur and Sun sessions. You can attend more than 1 session a week however if you can repeat the session you attend on your own a few times before next week you should get maximum benefit. There will be a session plan to take a photo of each session. Nothing to bring but yourselves however optional additions would be a yoga mat for floor work and non marking shoes. Outside shoes not to be worn in the squash court however socks ok for most exercises. When arriving, head to the courts and find Trevor. If you can't make it there aren't any refunds issued inside 24 hours of the event but let us know please so someone else can join in. If you know you can't make it more than 24 hours before the event 'request a refund' through Eventbrite and you'll get the money back minus the administration fee. This will then free up a ticket for someone else to book. If you have any questions, let us know!
Organizer: Walthamstow Cricket, Tennis and Squash Club
Title: Trev stretch & HIIT sessions in a squash court
Subtitle: High Intensity Interval Training - 4 sessions a week to cater all schedules

Description: Celebrity Creations Management Presents LUXE SWAPZ LONDON! The Popular UNISEX Fashion Swap Shop is BACK AGAIN! Dropping another edition of their popular swap shops, right on the tail of London Fashion Week SS24, Luxe Swapz London, brings a little extra luxury and vibes to the eco-friendly trend of clothes swapping! Grabs your friends and your swap shop tickets and head down to Stratford, East London on Sunday 10th March 2024 for a fun afternoon filled of swapping and socialising, with music, jumbo games, competitions and more! Luxe Swapz London's pop-up fashion swap shops have been running for three years now and we have so much more planned to revolutionaise the idea of ethical shopping and swapping! We bring you a fun, low cost, sustainable way to update your wardrobe and recycle your clothing - without the hefty pricetags alongside lots of treats at each event! Bring along some nice, trendy, unwanted clothing, shoes and accessories and swap them for something fresh, fashionable and new-to-you! One persons "I don't intend to wear this" is another persons "OMG, I have to have it" - LET'S GO! Unisex adult clothing is available across our boutique popup store, already filled with rail upon rail and shelf upon shelf of quality clothing and accessories ready for swapping! The higher quality clothing you bring, the higher the amount of tokens you will receive to swap them for the items stacked up in our Luxe Swapz pop-up boutique store to the same value. WHAT DOES YOUR TICKET GET YOU? Grab your "swap tickets" if you know you have unwanted clothing to swap or alternatively you can just purchase a "browse and buy" ticket to enter the boutique and shop around like you would in a regular shop (with cash or card) and purchase what you like at SUPER DISCOUNTED PRICES without swapping. Many items BRAND NEW WITH TAGS alongside second chance items from our past Luxe Swapz shoppers! You will love the experience and leave with some great new items to wear this summer and beyond! Run out of your swaps and want to take home more items from the boutique? Everything in the boutique is available for purchase and we accept both card and cash so don't worry! See more items in the shop that you want to take home but don't have enough swap tokens? No worries! Items in the shop can also be purchased on the day starting from just ¬£1! Just check the tags in the boutique! HOW IT WORKS: - Your Ticket grants you access to the Luxe Swapz Pop-Up Boutique Store and the ability to swap your unwanted items inside for something new-to-you! - Bring along the amount of items featured on your chosen ticket (please no holes, rips or stains, please make sure you have washed the clothing so that it is fresh and ready for someone else to love) - Your clothing that you bring will immediately be exchanged for Luxe Swapz Boutique shopping tokens! These are your currency to spend inside the store! The higher the value of your clothing (detemined by our experienced team) the higher the value of tokens you will recieve in store! - We have an array of clothes, shoes, sneakers, hats, bags and accessories ranging from new with tags and designer wear to second chance treasures and high street brands - all of which we are sure you will love! - Items in the swap shop include previous swap items from past Luxe Swapz events as well as trendy current and vintage items sourced by the Luxe Swapz teams at thrift store, online and from charity shops across London! - Music - we spin the tunes throughout the event to create a vibe! Its also not rare to find known female DJ's spinning at special Luxe Swapz events! - Networking and Socialise with other swappers - we have a beautiful swap community! Come and socialise and enjoy the events with us! Don't be afraid to come alone, we are mega friendly! - Sponsors - from time to time at special editions we have sponsors who provide freebies, goodybags, free event tickets and more! - Jumbo games ...and more treats on the day including exclusive items and competitions
Title: THE BIG UNISEX FASHION SWAP SHOP by Luxe Swapz London
Subtitle: The next level of swap shops ! Don't wear it? Bring it, Swap it, Love it!

Description: Join the Thames Discovery Programme on a guided walk on the Thames foreshore at Putney. Escape London's crowds with our expert archaeologists and discover the archaeology of this iconic historic area. Whilst immersed in a hidden urban environment with breathtaking views, learn about: Please be aware that this event involves walking across uneven and muddy ground. The walk will begin at: The ramp in front of the Boathouse Pub at the bottom of Brewhouse Lane (Find the location on: What3Words or Google Maps) Our guided foreshore walks help support our work to monitor and record the vulnerable archaeology on the Thames foreshore. Our walks are extremely popular and usually sell out, please cancel your ticket as soon as possible if you‚Äôre not able to attend. Someone else may want your space. We‚Äôll refund anyone who cancels their place up to 24 hours before the start of the event. NB Eventbrite's booking fee is non-refundable in most cases. Visit our website for more information about what to expect on one of our guided walks, especially if you haven't been to the foreshore before. The foreshore surface can be uneven and muddy ‚Äì please wear sturdy footwear, waterproof boots or wellies are recommended! Please don't wear open-toed footwear. In case of bad weather, the walks may be postponed or cancelled. Please note: The tickets include the nearest postcode, but might not take you all the way to the meeting place. Google maps and other online maps can be confusing as they don‚Äôt recognise the names of the river stairs or foreshore features, and may send you to the wrong place. We suggest: get to the postcode or ideally use what3words, find the river, and you should find us nearby! The Thames Discovery Programme leads regular guided walks on the foreshore for adults, and families with older children and teenagers. These walks focus on the history and heritage of the river including those structures and features exposed by the movement of sediment in this dynamic environment, which are monitored and archaeologically recorded by our Foreshore Recording and Observation Group (FROGs).  Thanks to the kind permission of the Port of London Authority, some surface-only artefact handling may be permitted when attending a TDP foreshore walk, but all finds must be examined by the archaeologist on site, and significant finds must be recorded with the Portable Antiquities Scheme. Please be aware that if you wish to search the foreshore for artefacts at other times you must be in possession of a Permit to Search the Foreshore, issued by the Port of London Authority.
Title: Guided foreshore archaeology walk: Putney
Subtitle: Explore the archaeology of the Thames Foreshore with our archaeologist at Putney

Description: Want to get to know London through its parks? Join a Walk that takes in the Parks of the east side of London along the River Lea. Starting at Stratford Station we will walk through Olympic Park, Three Mills Green, West Ham's Memorial Recreation Ground, Hermit Road Rec, Star Lane Park, Malmesbury Road Park, Bow Creek Ecology Park and Botanic Square on the Leamouth Peninsula. The walk covers about 5 miles and will take about 2 hours, finishing at a gallery on the new City Island at Bow Creek. Accompanied children and dogs free - but the dogs have to be kept on a lead, and not bother other participants. Where possible we try to choose an accessible route. Note there are two steep sets of steps and an unsurfaced river-side path. Meeting place: Stratford Station, south side by foot of stairs to WestfieldTake the tube: Central line, DLR, Elizabeth, Jubilee or Overground to StratfordDate & time: Sunday March 10th 2024, 1 pmDistance: about 5 miles End point: Lighthouse Gallery, City Island, Lyell Street Maps: Google, Komoot Cost: ¬£8 early bird (upto 15 tickets) / ¬£12 thereafter, per adult walkerContact: email: Tim [splot] Ingram-Smith [splat] virgin.net mobile: 077932 00932 Some refreshments and high-rise art by Park-to-Park‚Äôs artist-in-resident Gail Astbury at the Lighthouse Gallery to finish.
Title: Park to Park Sunday walk - Olympic Park to Bow Creek
Subtitle: Join us as we explore the parks and canyons bookending Bow Creek, from Stratford to Canning Town.

Description: CRUISING is a weekly cinema social that pairs cult, curious and classic cinema with friendly film chat in the Theatreship bar, hosted by queer film fanatic Token Homo (creator of BAR TRASH, ‚ÄúLondon‚Äôs most fun & informative film night‚Äù). Ten survivors struggle to escape from an ocean liner capsized by a tidal wave. Ronald Neame‚Äôs multiple Oscar-winning THE POSEIDON ADVENTURE (1972) starts like CARRY ON CRUISING (casting Leslie Nielsen as the doomed ship‚Äôs captain doesn‚Äôt help‚Ä¶), but soon takes a dramatic ‚Äì upside down ‚Äì turn, becoming the quintessential 1970s disaster movie done right. Featuring an excellent ensemble cast ‚Äì including several Oscar winners ‚Äì THE POSEIDON ADVENTURE was partly filmed aboard the retired luxury ocean liner RMS Queen Mary in Long Beach, California. Now you can experience the ultimate escape-room thriller onboard the atmospheric setting of Theatreship. All survivors are invited to join Token Homo in the venue bar afterwards to celebrate the star-studded world of 1970s disaster movies. Queer-led, CRUISING promotes inclusion through accessible programming, vibrant hosting, radical film histories, and a diverse lineup of guests with their own distinctive voices. All films are served with intros, intermissions, and post-screening conversations. For adults aged 18+ only.
Title: CRUISING #02: The Poseiden Adventure
Subtitle: A weekly cinema social that pairs cult, curious, and classic cinema with friendly film chat in the Theatreship bar

Description: Sunday evening in-person session is a "sonic massage" for body and spirit.  An excellent peaceful re-set for both heart and mind for the week ahead! This session includes: Gong, Himalayan Singing Bowls, Crystal Singing Bowls, and Chimes Lie back and let the specially designed Sound Bath take you into a state of deep, therapeutic, restorative relaxation.  The body holds onto our thoughts and emotions, which can become tension points and blockages over time. Sound healing relaxes and releases where your body needs it most at that particular time ... vibrational therapy is magical.   What to expect:  Wear comfy clothes, and bring something to lie on (mat or blanket), a pillow for your head or under your knees, and an eye mask or scarf.  A light blanket is a nice idea, too, since the body tends to cool in deep relaxation.  No movement is involved, and no fitness level or previous experience is required. You simply lie back on a mat whilst experiencing a variety of sound instruments played in certain ways, combinations, and sequences designed to address: My sound healing work is backed by up-to-the-minute medical and scientific research AND the time-tested wisdom of ancient practices.  Sound is good medicine!  PÔªøS: let me know if sitting in a chair is more comfortable for you than getting down on the floor, and I will provide one. Venue: the lovely, historic ETNA Community Centre in beautiful St Margarets, just over the bridge from Richmond.  Free parking in the building's lot. ETNA Community Centre is within easy walking distance of St Margaret‚Äôs Station, and 5 bus stops from Richmond Station (frequent service). Bus stop Poplar Court is just around the corner on Richmond / St Margarets Road. what3words ///button.ballots.shake How Sound Therapy works:  Sound is literally energy that we can hear and feel! And sound therapies can be a powerful form of energy healing. Sound waves can connect or ‚Äúentrain‚Äù with our brain waves to induce deep healing, and are often used in trauma therapy. This holistic practice works with sound wave frequencies to remediate the body's systems as an integrated whole.  Experiencing a Sound Bath can help return the body to a healthy state of "flow" by opening blockages in the body's systems, including circulatory, lymphatic, brain and nerves, endocrine (hormone), digestive, and immune.  Plus sound vibrations can heal the body all the way down to the cellular level!
Organizer: A Tempo Sound Therapy with Jane Kight
Title: New Moon Sound Healing with Gong & Bowls - ¬£24 (¬£20 early bird)
Subtitle: Experience deep, therapeutic relaxation through sound. Untangle stress, insomnia, "monkey mind".  Find balance.

Description: Behind that Door - Unlocking the history of 22 Ridgway, Wimbledon This special exhibition explores the rich history of the Wimbledon Village Club and Lecture Hall building from its Victorian origins, intended to entice locals away from the pub towards more intellectual pursuits. Over the years the building has witnessed a full spectrum of experiences, providing piety and sobriety, shelter and camaraderie, conviviality and revelry. Discover the captivating stories of those who have lived, learned, taken refuge, created and drunk within its walls! Join us for this fascinating in-person event at the Wimbledon Museum. Open every Friday, Saturday and Sunday from 2:30 to 5pm, from 2nd February to 24th March. Access: Please note the museum is on the 1st floor, up a flight of stairs.
Title: Behind that Door - Unlocking the history of 22 Ridgway, Wimbledon
Subtitle: Explore the captivating past of 22 Ridgway, Wimbledon founded as a Victorian endeavour to lure people away from the pub. 2 Feb to 24 March.

Description: T ICKET PRICES üü¢ T HE FIRST 5 TICKETS ARE FREE üü§ T HE NEXT 5 TICKETS ARE ¬£4.50 ONLY üî¥ REMAINING TICKETS ON THE LINE ARE ¬£9.50 ONLY üü£ TICKETS AT THE DOOR ARE ¬£15 In this workshop Ryan explains why people often have emotions blocking them (usually nervousness) in social situations & how to deal with this to not miss out on opportunities. In the 2nd half he explains how to smoothly start a conversation & make it flow. üîµ - Understand why people get nervous in social situations or have other emotions blocking them from socialising üü£ - How to reduce & overcome nervousness or other emotions blocking you from socialising üü† - How to start a conversation easily in almost any situation üü¢ - How to use positioning & body language to make starting a conversation much easier üîµ - How to get a conversation flowing after starting it ‚ö´ - Brain training exercises designed to increase sharpness at this area of social skills üî¥ - A challenge at the end to bring everything from the workshop together Ryan has been coaching people social skills full time for over 10 years. As a quiet & shy person he wanted to work on his own social skills & after making huge improvements plus understanding how social situations work & how to improve he developed a process to help others for every area of social skills. He has helped thousands of people over the years to improve & now has a huge following including over 180000 followers on TikTok. More info on Ryan & Social Shortcuts can be found on the website www.socialshortcuts.com After workshops we spend time hanging out together, a great opportunity to practice the workshop content & make new friends. Plus Ryan is happy to answer any questions you want to ask one to one. üü¢Workshop happening after before this: 1. Description: At various times between 1904 and her death in 1941, Virginia Woolf had a home in Bloomsbury. And we will hear about some of the other well known writers who also lived in Bloomsbury, such as T S Eliot and Lytton Strachey...¬† You can check travel options at the¬†Transport for London Journey Planner.¬†
Title: Walking Tour -  Squares, Circles, Triangles - Literary Bloomsbury
Subtitle: Join Stephen to explore the Bloomsbury of Virginia Woolf and her friends. They lived in squares, painted in circles and loved in triangles.

Description: Cacao Ceremony themes:  Our ancestors understood and were sensitive to the changing seasons, the shifting states of nature and the effect that this had on their mental and physical bodies. We have become increasingly disconnected and so, we suffer physically and mentally. BUT more and more of us are responding to the need to reconnect to nature; humanity's great mirror. Even in the intensity of urban London we can reconnect. Cacao ceremony is one way to do so. Join us for a nourishing, nurturing and natural re-connection to & celebration of the cycles of nature. N ote: I send a guidance email a day or two before the ceremony. Please look out for this as sometimes it gets sent to people's spam box :-) A little on Ceremonial Cacao: Cacao is a heart-opening drink made from raw cacao bean paste - it is chocolate in its purest form. It gently but powerfully heightens and accelerates any personal development and transformations that you are working on/through at this time. Cacao will only work with your intentions and does not push you beyond your limits like other plant medicines. Most people experience drinking cacao as blissful and relaxing. To receive maximum benefits and maximum bliss, it is best to avoid caffeine on the day of the ceremony, avoid alcohol for at least 24 hours beforehand and avoid heavy meals on the day. Eat something light approx 2 hours prior to the ceremony. Arrive hydrated. Contraindications are those taking anti-depressants (cacao naturally boosts serotonin levels) , pregnant women and those with high blood pressure and/or heart disease. Please inform me if any of these apply to you and an alternative to cacao or a lower dose will be provided. This does not affect the impact that gathering in cacao ceremony can have upon your personal growth. Cacao ceremony reviews: Thank you as always for holding space and creating such a beautiful opportunity to heal, grow and learn! x F elicity's cacao ceremonies are really something special! Felicity is an excellent space holder and meditation guide. She guides you through the most beautiful meditation. Her cacao is divine. She offers wise insights into the oracle cards and the light circle is an incredibly powerful experience. Thank you for the deep healing Felicity, I can't wait to attend more events. I wanted to let you know that after setting my intention of getting a job that matched my purpose and passion at the ceremony, I have been invited to 3 interviews this week. This was after months of applying and not getting anything back so thank you for such a powerful and nurturing ceremony ‚ù§ This was my first cacao ceremony. Thank you so much for creating and holding such a supportive and cleansing space. It was a magical ceremony!
Title: Super New Moon in Pisces Cacao Ceremony
Subtitle: Accelerate your personal growth with cacao. Set intentions & nurture your energetic body. Soothing, heart opening & profoundly directional.

Description: This alternative therapy is based on the concept that the ear is a microsystem reflecting the entire body - in a similar way to reflexology. There's over 200 points on the ear! By placing several acupuncture needles into a selection of these points creates a targeted response in the body, promoting natural self-healing of the concern being treated. Some of the benefits include: overall sense of well-being, restore body to a state of homeostasis (Balancing Yin and Yang), increased calmness, pain relief, improved sleep, relief from stress and/or emotional trauma, inner quiet, strength and connection to self. The treatment can also be tailored to specific concerns such as - anxiety, depression, musculoskeletal pain, addictions, migraines, side effects of steroid treatments, allergies, insomnia and more. Please note: Acupuncture is not suitable for the following: Accessibility: The Centre's accessibility statement is here. Covid and mpox safety at the London LGBTQ+ Community Centre: To keep our community safe, we ask that all visitors do not visit the Centre if they are feeling any Covid-19 and/or mpox symptoms including headache, fever, sore throat, consistent cough, chills and unusual spots, scabs or ulcers. You can wear a mask if you feel more comfortable. We also have masks and hand sanitiser available at the Centre. For current information on Covid and mpox please visit the NHS website.
Title: The Community Acupuncture Clinic
Subtitle: Discover a natural way to improve your overall health, energy and sense of wellbeing through Auricular Acupuncture

Description: How do we revisit our published and unpublished work in order to make something new from it? Is this 're-visiting' a valuable way to deepen our practice, to look at our creative preoccupations in new ways and from different perspectives? Do we only ever write one poem using different words? Can this make us feel stuck, and how do we liberate ourselves to go back, re-tread old ground and dig up new poetry bones? Participants will be given creative prompts and plenty of quiet, relaxed time to write. Open to new and experienced writers. Workshop dates (please note this is a two-part workshop) Sunday 10th March 4.30-6pm Sunday 17th March 4.30-6pm About the tutor: Jenny Mitchell won the Gregory O‚ÄôDonoghue Prize in 2023 for a single poem, and the Poetry Book Awards 2021 for her second collection, Map of a Plantation, which is on the syllabus at Manchester Metropolitan University. The prize-winning debut collection, Her Lost Language, is One of 44 Poetry Books for 2019 (Poetry Wales), and her latest collection, Resurrection of a Black Man, contains three prize-winning poems and is featured on the USpodcast Poetry Unbound. She‚Äôs won numerous competitions, is widely-published, hasperformed at the Houses of Parliament and has just been made Poet-in-Residence at Sussex University.
Title: Poetry and Resurrection with Jenny Mitchell
Subtitle: A  two-part workshop on Re-creating Our Own Poems

Description: ParkBathe is a citizen-science project providing mindful walks and nature connection as a means to improve the health and wellbeing of people who might not normally engage in wellness activities. ParkBathe uses aspects of 'forest bathing', forest school and mindfulness and involves walking slowly in a local green space whilst noticing our surroundings (no water is involved!) This session (affectionately called "BarkBathe")  is DOG-FRIENDLY which means well-behaved pooches are welcome to join. People without their own dog are also encouraged to come along too. The 1 hr guided sessions consist of small groups (max 12 people) in Cator Park run in collaboration with the Friends of group. These sessions are offered free with the option to DONATE. We ask you to pause a moment before you book and consider if you can afford a donation ticket today. Donating allows us to continue providing these walks to those who cannot afford to pay. For guidance on what to donate and our policy head HERE. * We suggest you book up to 3 sessions so you gain the accumulative benefits and learn the techniques for yourself. Wear warm layers, sturdy shoes and wet weather gear as required (we go out in the rain!). Pls bring water/snacks/suncream according to season. MEETING PLACE: The Children's Nursery on Aldersmead road, Cator Park BN3. Here is a precise what3words address, made of 3 random words. ///steer.spark.tells https://w3w.co/steer.spark.tells To find out more about ParkBathe, listen to our PODCAST and SUBSCRIBE for walk updates HERE. Our PODCAST is packed with interviews with world-renowned forest bathing scientists, nature experts and previous ParkBathers and includes a self-guided audio track you can use in your local park! REGISTRATION: To comply with our insurance, all participants must agree to the walk T&C at Eventbrite checkout. CITIZEN SCIENCE: Over the last year we have taken over 700 people on walks and collected a wealth of health data. These results are currently being published in two papers. Any questions email Vanessa at parkbathe@gmail.com or you can access all information on our WEBSITE
Title: Dog-friendly ParkBathe in CATOR PARK
Subtitle: 1 hr slow, silent, guided mindful walk  in CATOR PARK to engage the senses & de-stress.

Description: There are so many ways we can connect with psilocybin, and the wonderful thing about mushrooms is that they do different things at different doses. Lenna will talk about her own personal experience and her long-standing relationship with psilocybin, how it helped her recover from life-long depression, as well her experiences guiding people through psychedelic journeys. She will also touch on the importance of preparation and integration and how these two important phases can help you to get the most out of a psychedelic experience. What to expect Expect great discussion, a chance to ask lots of questions, and building community over our signature rose tea! If you have any questions that you would specifically like Lenna to address, please note these upon booking. About Lenna: Lenna is the founder of Shift Happens - a holistic healing & psychedelic integration platform which aims to support people on their journey of psychedelic exploration. Her own integration began when she experienced a profound encounter with Ayahuasca, which led to a spiritual emergency due to lack of support, stability or internal framework. Through navigating this crisis, she discovered inner resources, practices and tools to integrate those difficult experiences and eventually began supporting other‚Äôs to do the same. During this time she found a strong ally in the mushrooms which helped her to peel back the layers of trauma, conditioning and limiting beliefs that were causing her life-long depression. She formed a deep connection with these teachers and believes that taking the time to create a relationship with them can be life changing. Lenna remains connected to the psychedelic realms but keeps her feet firmly on the ground straddling both the mystical and the everyday reality of being human. Lenna‚Äôs approach is relatable, grounded and centres on empowering her clients to become their own guides and healers. Important:
Title: TALK SERIES | THE MAGIC OF MUSHROOMS | AN INTRODUCTORY TALK
Subtitle: For the next instalment of the F+A Talk Series, we will be joined by Lenna from Shift Happens. Lenna will be speaking about the mushroom...

Description: About the New Moon in PiscesWater sign Pisces is the last sign of the zodiac, so the Pisces New Moon is all about checking in on our emotions before the astrological new year begins in Aries season.This particular lunar event is also a good time to set some intentions. The sign of Pisces is ruled by Neptune, planet of dreams and illusions, so let your imagination loose. This new moon is the perfect astrological event for manifesting your dream life!. What to expect? Ceremonial cacao is a heart-opening drink made from raw cacao beans - it is chocolate in its purest form and is historically renowned for its many health benefits that support physical and psychological well-being. It gently but powerfully clears energetic blockages, and helps us to open and embrace our hearts. The cacao for this event will be beautifully complimented by a self love sound bath and meditation. We will begin the session by silently setting our individual intentions for the ceremony. We will mindfully drink the Cacao, experiencing it‚Äôs warmth and presence in the body. Followed by an immersive sound journey dedicated to raising vibrations and showing yourself the love you deserve. We are going to dive deep with a powerful sound journey, raising vibrations to the frequency of self love. Evening highlights It is our absolute pleasure to offer you this safe space for you to take some well deserved time for you to rest, relax, realign and to release what is no longer serving you. 1. Cacao ceremony & oracle cards 2. Heart opening guided meditation 3. Full Moon soothing sound bath Journey THINGS TO NOTE To receive maximum benefits and maximum bliss, it is best to avoid caffeine on the day of the ceremony, avoid alcohol for at least 24 hours beforehand and avoid heavy meals on the day. Eat something light approx 2 hours prior to the ceremony. Arrive hydrated. CONSIDERATIONS & CONTRAINDICATIONS: - Cacao contains theobromine which stimulates the system much in the same way as caffeine can. If you have a sensitivity to caffeine then please consult with me and we will discuss you having a smaller dose. - Cacao can react with certain anti depressants causing headaches so please let me know if you are on any medication before booking - Please let me know if you are on any heart medication, pregnant or breast feeding (The Cacao is optional so you can still attend this workshop without drinking it). In booking your ticket, you certify to understanding all of the above to participate in this ceremony. If you have any dietary requirements or allergies please let me know beforehand. The Cacao is made with Oat milk, cinnamon, honey, cardamon and vanilla . We can prep an option with no added ingrediants but need to be made aware of this 24 hours before event. Feel free to message me any questions you have via info@theselflovelab.co.uk or via instagram @theselflovelab.co.uk Please arrive between 4.45pm - 5pm for a prompt start. DOORS CLOSE at 5pm - entry will not be permitted after this. About Zehra Zehra is a qualified sound therapist and the founder of the self love lab. Her sound has made it into the pages of british vogue and she has recently hosted a sound bath for 1000 people as part of roxie nafousi' manifest workshop. She regularly hosts corporate events and 1-1 sound baths for her london clientele. She cannot wait to welcome you all.
Title: New Moon Heart Opening Cacao Ceremony + Sound Bath evening
Subtitle: Experience a New Moon heart-opening cacao ceremony and soothing sound bath evening

Description: The Last Year of Darkness is a coming-of-age documentary following five friends in the underground party scene in Chengdu. The film is a celebration of the ephemerality of youth and a love letter to the underground community partying at Funky Town, an unassuming corner bar hidden by Chengdu‚Äôs construction crane. For a vibrant group of DJs, drag performers, lovers, ravers, and skaters, Funky Town is a sanctuary for underground partying; the one place that accepts them for who they really are. But this documentary also sheds light on the challenges the protagonists are facing, from depression to questioning their sexuality, the exhaustion that comes from living as an artist, and the struggles they face just trying to keep the lights on. The Last Year of Darkness is Ben Mullinkosson‚Äôs second feature length documentary. His first feature DON'T BE A DICK ABOUT IT won the 2018 Audience Award at IDFA. He‚Äôs been awarded the Cannes Silver Lion Advertising award, Vimeo Staff Picks, NYT Op-Docs, and some of his films have accrued millions of views. His previous short films have been screened in over 50 festivals around the world including Tribeca (GNARLY IN PINK) and Slamdance (WHAT I HATE ABOUT MYSELF). ************************************************************************************************************** We uncover venues and events you may have missed otherwise with a focus on alternative and thought-provoking shows. Our team of curators is dedicated to finding shows that are experimental, unexpected, innovative, and genre-defying. We strive to challenge your perspective and inspire you with events and places that are often under-the-radar and unconventional. *************************************************************************************************************
Title: La Fomo Club ‚Äì The Last Year Of Darkness Screening + Cast and Director Q&A
Subtitle: La Fomo Club is back with a screening of The Last Year Of Darkness celebrating the underground party scene in Chengdu, China.

Description: HEY YOU, Women's Circles are nothing new. They have been taking place for eons. In little tribes somewhere in the middle of the rainforest. With our grandmothers around an open fire in the garden. In community centers spread across the western world. In living rooms across London. Step into a sanctuary of empowerment and transformation at my upcoming Women's Circle event. Join us for an unforgettable journey of self-discovery and sisterhood where you can bask in a safe and nurturing environment crafted specifically for women like you. At my circle, I prioritize your well-being and growth, fostering an atmosphere of trust and authenticity where you can freely express yourself without fear of judgment. You'll embark on a profound exploration of your inner wisdom, unlocking the potential within you to thrive in every aspect of your life. Be part of a supportive community of women who uplift and inspire each other, forming connections that transcend boundaries and last a lifetime. Whether you seek solace, guidance, or simply a space to recharge, my Women's Circle promises to rejuvenate your spirit and ignite the flame of empowerment within you. Don't miss this opportunity to nourish your soul and embrace the transformative power of gathering with  other women in circle. Secure your ticket today and embark on a journey towards greater self-discovery, connection, and empowerment. Your presence is not just welcomed; it's celebrated. No matter where in life you are at right now and what struggles you are going through, know that you are not alone. This Women's Circle will take place on the new moon - also known as the dark moon. A potent time for new beginnings and circle work. Not only that but it is Mother's Day here in the UK too, which can bring up a lot of mixed emotions. Our evening together will include a sharing circle, a guided meditation and some energy healing. Time permitting, I also like to include embodiment and physical practices,which are totally optional and could look like this: which could look like the following: - dancing/movement - group exercises - journalling - voice work - sound healing SPACES ARE LIMITED in order to guarantee an intimate and cosy atmosphere. This event is for women and anybody that identifies as a woman. Come as you are! Come alone or bring a loved one! See you there! Theresa X &osteo in Brockley is a couple of minutes from Brockley overground station and on many bus routes. The studio has yoga mats, bolsters and eye pillows. Please bring a blanket, journal and anything else you need to feel comfortable. Please arrive 10 minutes before the session begins and avoid being late, as late-comers cannot be admitted. The event starts at 6:00 pm and finishes at 8:00 pm. Please be punctual :-)
Title: Women's Circle in Brockley
Subtitle: Women, it's time to gather in circle. Time to connect, be heard and witnessed. Take this sacred space to nourish your mind, body and soul.

Description: What is balance, harmony or the ideal self to you?  Have you been recently feeling a bit overwhelmed, stressed or disconnected with yourself and others? Chances are that your energetic centre has been thrown of its equilibrium at some point and only now symptoms of that have come to the surface of your consciousness.  Sacral chakra is closely linked to our adrenal glands, sexual organs and the way we process water in our bodies. Our fight and flight responses are commonly triggered by stress that stimulates release of adrenaline, which is a normal reaction that helps our body and mind coping better at a given time. Prolonged exposure to stress causes chronic illnesses. Emotions like fear and anger are common triggers of this state. By stimulating Sacral Chakra area we are going to be focusing on relaxing these responses down and activating so called lower road of our fight and flight responses, where we take our time to evaluate and cope in a much calmer manner. This process helps getting in touch with our own inner sense of joy that we will be establishing a path to in this session.  It is more important than ever to be intentional in this day and age, we will focus on a complete de-strestressing, cleansing and an intention setting.  Sound healing is a practice that uses harmonic vibrations to harmonise brainwaves: combining sound therapy with hypnotherapy and other healing modalities, we achieve distressing, brain fog removal and a deeper meditative state.  Hypnotherapy is a completely safe method allowing a deeper connection within our selves elevating the effects of sound therapy.  Hand in hand it is an incredible combination.  The session will start with a light grounding meditation and a healing touch, followed by carefully selected sound journey frequencies activating your sacral chakra, sealing the session with hypnotherapy which will deepen your experience.  This workshop is very attentive, individually tailored for everyone to have an amazing experience.  There will be a window of 15 mins before and after the 75mins session addressing your own personal concerns and questions.  Please arrive for 18:50, we will start at 19:00.  Lenka Kopecka is a psychotherapist, clinical hypnotherapist, NLP master prac, high performance coach and an athlete.  Coming from a long family line of healers she has trained with the best and most dedicated trainers/healers in the world.  She has dedicated over a decade to intensive studies of various healing and conventional therapy methods in order to achieve an integrative healing approach of physical/mental/emotional/spiritual aspects of one's being. Description: Fabrications Introduction To Hand Sewing Repairs (Woollens) Here at Fabrications we are regularly asked if we undertake repairs and alterations to various items of clothing.¬†With Hackney's moth epidemic on the increase, it should come as no surprise that the most popular requests are for repairs to woollen jumpers. Although we do not undertake garment repairs we usually offer those enquiring two options for repairs. The first option we recommend is that the person try using a dry cleaners to undertake the job. However, we always point out that this can often work out as an expensive option. Along with that option we always try to encourage the person to try to carrying out the repair themselves, offering advice on ways that they might achieve this. Sadly, in recent years, and maybe as a result our growing ‚Äúthrow away‚Äù culture, there has been a marked decline in the practice of learning even the most basic of clothing repair skills. As such, many of us now lack a real understanding of the various stitching techniques and tricks, used in basic fabric repairs. This is also the case with traditional weaving and darning techniques used to mend and prolong the life of our cherished woollen garments. In light of this situation, Barley has put together a comprehensive hand repair workshop focusing on common woollen garment repairs. The workshop is not only very informative, but also very enjoyable encouraging a really mindful approach to clothing repairs. On completion of the class participants will confidently be able to: - Use 2 types of 'Darning' techniques: Traditional Weave & Swiss Darning - Apply techniques to different weights of woolens from fine cashmere jumpers to chunky hand knits - Explore 'Visible Mending' -Ôªø Learn how to re stitch unravelled seams and cuffs. - Consider different colour combinations and creative features. - Work on your own mending pile! Class Size: Max 6 students TÔªøime: 2:30  - 5pm (Please arrive promptly) Class Includes:  A starter darning kit and different woollen swatches to practise on (you are also welcome to bring along items of clothing to work on directly. Please ensure any moth eaten items have been put in the freezer for at least 1 week to kill any moth eggs that may still be dormant in the item before introducing to our studio!) Please Note: The workshop will take place in the Fabrications studio (which is downstairs from the shop via 12 steps)   There is no food or drink allowed in the studio, You are welcome to bring a sealed water bottle but please ensure all 'take outs' are consumed before arriving. For full day classes there is a scheduled lunch break. Please let us know know if you are unable to attend or are running late by calling Fabrications on 020 7275 8043 Full Booking Terms & Conditions: HERE FÔªøor more information on Fabrications, please visit our Website
Title: Grandma's Hands: Introduction to hand sewing repairs (Woolens)
Subtitle: A comprehensive introduction to different methods of hand sewing or darning your holey woollens!
