Description: Fabrications Introduction To Hand Sewing Repairs Here at Fabrications we are regularly asked if we undertake repairs and alterations to various items of clothing. The most common repairs requested include such things as: hemming skirts or trousers, repairing holes in pockets, repairing small tears or rips in garments, sewing on missing buttons, and repairing or patching denim jeans which have worn away on the inside thigh area. Although we do not undertake garment repairs we usually offer those enquiring two options for repairs. The first option we recommend is that the person try using a dry cleaners to undertake the job. However, we always point out that this can often work out as an expensive option. Along with that option we always try to encourage the person to try to carrying out the repair themselves, offering advice on ways that they might achieve this. Sadly, in recent years, and maybe as a result our growing ‚Äúthrow away‚Äù culture, there has been a marked decline in the practice of learning even the most basic of clothing repair skills. As such, many of us now lack a real understanding of the various stitching techniques and tricks, used in basic fabric repairs. In light of this situation, Barley has put together a comprehensive hand repair workshop focusing on both common fabric and woollen garments. The workshop is not only very informative, but also very enjoyable encouraging a really mindful approach to clothing repairs. On completion of the class participants will confidently be able to: - Know how to use 5 key hand sewing stitches: Back Stitch, Buttonhole Stitch, Running Stitch, Slip Stitch & Whipping Stitch - 'Hem' by hand (changing the length of a garment or repair a frayed edge) - Fix rips, holes and other wear & tear areas - Repair seams (joins in your garment) - Sew on buttons, poppers & hooks/bars - Explore traditional & creative choices for your repair work - Work on your mending pile with joy! Class includes a starter sewing kit and fabric swatches to practise on (you are also welcome to bring along items of clothing to work on directly) There is a Woollen Repairs class in the afternoon. we offer a discount when booking the full day! Class Size: Max 6 students T ime: 11am - 1:30pm (Please arrive promptly) Class Includes: A starter sewing kit and a fabric swatch to practise on that will become a small needle case (you are also welcome to bring along items of clothing to get advice on / work on directly) Please Note: The workshop will take place in the Fabrications studio (which is downstairs from the shop via 12 steps) There is no food or drink allowed in the studio, You are welcome to bring a sealed water bottle but please ensure all 'take outs' are consumed before arriving. For full day classes there is a scheduled lunch break. Please let us know know if you are unable to attend or are running late by calling Fabrications on 020 7275 8043 Full Booking Terms & Conditions: HERE T o find out more about Fabrications, please visit our Website
Title: Grandma's Hands: Introduction to hand sewing repairs (fabric items)
Subtitle: A comprehensive introduction to a series of practical hand sewing stitches for textile and clothing repair or making from scratch.

Description: Over this one day course, you will be introduced to the ancient art of Blacksmithing. You will be guided through the art of forging by blacksmith and knife maker Sacha Lacey. Under guidance you will learn how to transform a piece of steel bar into a personalised bottle opener, that is both functional and decorative, using traditional techniques. This will involve learning tapering, flattening, hot punching, drifting a hole, twisting and hot stamping. After perfecting your creation, you will then learn how to seal the piece using hot wax. TÔªøhis course promises to be an exciting and informative learning experience for anyone who wants to try their hand at hot forge work, and get stuck in with a hammer on the anvil! Appropriate footwear must be worn for welding, leather shoes or boots or steel toe cap boots. Trainers are not suitable. Please note that refunds and/or changes to ticket date are available up to 7 days before course start date.   Once a course has started, we cannot offer any transfers or refunds.
Title: Introduction to Blacksmithing
Subtitle: Over this one day course, you  will be introduced to the  ancient art of Blacksmithing with professional blacksmith Sacha Lacey

Description: Throughout history and across cultures, mothers have been revered, celebrated, and honoured through various rituals, traditions, and holidays such as Mother's Day. This recognition acknowledges the immense sacrifices, hard work and unconditional love that mothers provide to their children, families and the world. This concept of motherhood is not limited to biological mothers. Adoptive mothers, stepmothers, foster mothers and other maternal figures can embody pillars of wisdom and take on such nurturing roles. The essence of motherhood is not solely defined simply by genetics but by the care and dedication a person passes on to someone they love. We also use the term "Mother Earth" or pachamama to personify the Earth itself as a nurturing and life-giving entity that provides sustenance and support for all living beings. Furthermore, the mother figure embodies the cycle of birth, growth, death, and rebirth that characterises the natural world. Is there someone you want to remember this Mother's day? A protector, a fighter, a healer? Is there someone you want to pay tribute to or celebrate? Perhaps you felt lacking of a mother's spirit and would like a safe space to acknowledge that missing, a nuturing place of empowerment, a circle filled with inspiring women, the collective 'mother'. We invite you to come as you are or bring a maternal woman you admire to an evening filled with group meditations, gratitude practices, creative writing, breathwork, restorative yoga, deeper connections - everything good for the soul.
Title: Mothers & Others: Women's Circle
Subtitle: SISTER SERIES is a non-profit Brent community project, set to unite, empower and connect women in a space where they can truly belong.

Description: "...Take courage, join hands, stand besides us, fight with us'' Christabel Pankhurst The militant actions of the suffragettes are firmly entrenched in our history books. Whether it's the shocking footage of Emily Wilding Davison martyring herself under the King's horse, or tiny Emmeline Pankhurst being carried, defiant, by two burly policeman as she screams 'Votes for Women!' - the extraordinary bravery and resilience of these heroines and what they achieved is taught in every school now, and their legacy affects us to this day. But what about some of the lesser known suffragettes, and how much of a role did the Police play, and the justice system who criminalised these women? Come and find out on our tour Votes for Women - Suffragettes of Bow Street and Beyond this Mother's Day! In proud association with the Bow Street Police Museum, allow Herstorical Tours to transport you back to Edwardian London, and retrace the footsteps quite literally! of these incredible women as they marched, preached, fought, smashed, burned and bombed their way to getting women the vote. From Westminster to Covent Garden, revisit the locations where the suffragettes held protests, rallies and staged some more *ahem* 'creative' stunts. See also where they were arrested and tried. On this tour you will see theatrical re-tellings of the stories of... Human smuggling involving a Music Hall star... Vandalism in the National Gallery... A disabled, working class suffragette of the East End... A refugee singer and actress who became an arsonist... An Indian Princess who joined the cause... ...and many more! The tour includes 50% off your entry fee to the Bow Street Police Museum, where you can learn more about the suffragettes and their brushes with the law in London. We're also offering an exclusive Mother's Day offer - buy 2 tickets, get one free! But these are limited, so get in quick by clicking the 'Mother's Day' option below and treat your Mum this Mother's Day. **Please note that there are no rest stops on this tour and you need to be able to walk long distances and stand throughout the 2 hours. We travel from Parliament Square to Covent Garden on foot. It is your responsibility to ensure you and your party are fit enough to take part.**
Title: Votes for Women! Suffragettes in Bow Street and Beyond!
Subtitle: Theatrical walking tour telling the stories of the lesser known suffragettes and incidents of the militant campaign.

It's really relaxing and satisfying experience - it allows you to get creative and sneak away from stressfull, busy city life. All you need to bring with you is a big smile. You will create something beautiful and natural while learning about nature.  You will get the chance to recreate mother earth's unique ecosystem in a terrarium to take home you with or give it to somebody you care about. Book your  slot for this class and join us this summer! Workshop schedule: * History of the terrariums * Techniques of layering and plant choice * Landscaping and decor of the terrarium * Watering methods * Best spot for the terrarium at home or work place * Online advice and aftercare of your creation * General plant care and tips What we offer: * in-person classes for public at our venue * group bookings at our venue * private family workshops at customers home * corporate office workshop events Please send us private message or email for any booking enquiries.

Description: At this Single Muslim Professional Speed Dating event you can expect to meet around 16-18 people in 4-5 minutes dates with an interval half way through for refreshments. Single Muslim Professionals Speed Dating kicks off at 6:30pm prompt and any guests arriving late may not be able to take part so please ensure you arrive 15minutes before the scheduled start time to allow for registration. When all the guests have arrived the host will explain how the evening will unfold and you will be provided with a scorecard, name badge and pen. When the event begins women will be seated and men will rotate between tables every 4minutes. At the end of each date guests mark on their scorecard whether they would like to see that person again. This location attracts a fun, crowd of single Muslim professionals from across London and the United Kingdom not just those working in the square mile. Join us and you‚Äôll be amazed how sociable People can be and be left wondering why you never tried speed dating sooner. Meeting new people in this way is hugely fun, highly energising and a brilliant way to start dating. Everyone‚Äôs single and up for meeting people so the success rate is very high. Book early, we'll sell out. There will be a 6:30pm minute break half way through to allow for refreshments. The event will finish around 8:00pm but guests are welcome to stay and mingle if they wish. Before you leave the host will collect all the scorecards in and collate the matches and the following day you will receive an e-mail with the results. Due to the popularity of this event, we advise you to book your ticket in advance and at your earliest to avoid disappointment. To ensure gender ratio, bookings are non-refundable. Note: we are not responsible for people's schedules - no show or late comers! Important information - Event starts 6:30pm - Speed dating finishes approximately 8:00pm - Venue closes 11.30pm It‚Äôs essential that you arrive before 6:30pm order to take part. We might not be able to allow entry if you are late. Price: ¬£24 PLEASE NOTE: Advance booking is essential and no tickets will be available to purchase on the door. Online booking is simple and very secure. Our payments are handled by Stripe, one of the world's largest payment processors using the highest grade security currently available. Nearest station-stratfod  Venue is 3 minute walk from Hayat Hotel in Westfield

Description:
Let's speak Italian in Hampstead Heath
 (This event is for Italian speakers, from beginners to native speakers)
 
 Hampstead Heath is one of the largest and most popular green spaces in the Greater London area. It is only 4 miles from central London but it feels like 4,000 miles from the bustle of the city. The Heath covers roughly 790 acres (about 360 hectares) and runs along a sandy ridge between Highgate to the east and Hampstead to the south-west.
 The park includes popular recreational facilities, including three open-air swimming pools.
 
 We will meet at Hampstead tube station and we will walk to the heath together.
 We will stop at Kenwood House and we will have a drink or a snack at Brew Caf√©, outside.
 Then, we will walk back to the tube station.
 Please note that we walk approximately 50 minutes to arrive at Kenwood House and it takes the same time to go back to Hampstead Station.
 
 I don‚Äôt encourage any late comer because the heath is huge. If you are late, just head to Kenwood House to meet us.
 I will leave our live location on google map on our WhatsApp group.
 
 Please bring a warm jumper and a raincoat, you may need them. I also recommend to wear good walking shoes. The heath can be muddy at this time of the year.
 
 On the day of the event, if the weather forecast announces heavy or continuous rain, we will go to a pub close to the station. So please check the event status before coming.
 
 I look forward to seeing you.
Title: Italian Conversation and Walk in Hampstead Heath
Subtitle: Italian Conversation while walking in Hampstead Heath on Sunday.

Description: Vocal Tai Chi Taster Workshops Join us for an exciting afternoon of Vocal Tai Chi Taster Workshops at Exchange House! This unique event combines the soothing practice of Tai Chi with the expressive power of vocals. Discover the art of harmonizing body movements and vocal techniques in a relaxed and friendly environment.In 2009 Jenni asked herself the question: "How can I improvise while meditating?" Vocal Tai Chi was her answer.Vocal Tai Chi is a vocal improvisation practice, rooted in a slow, grounded yet flowing bodywork practice - inspired by Tai Chi, while working with vocal improvisation, drone, modal scales and an inquiry into the vast array of timbres the voice holds, in the service of authentic vocal expression, artistic journey and healing process.The taster workshops in Vocal Tai Chi are a basic introduction to the principles and practice of Vocal Tai Chi - "a voice-life practice for the whole self."This is a single afternoon workshop, all comers are welcome, for refreshers or to taste for the first time. Come to one, or come to more than one.Taster workshops (2pm - 6pm) take place on a Sunday. There is another one on March 10th and another on May 5th.These are stand alone sessions, but can be used as a stepping stone towards the Foundation half module - taking place in April 2024 (four afternoons over two weekend) or indeed, the full apprenticeship in Vocal Tai Chi (begins September 2024 - 3 full modules).(5 practitioners were certified in September 2023 to practice Vocal Tai Chi with groups and individuals.)The afternoon is divided in two: group work 2pm-4pm, and (creatively witnessed) individual work 4pm - 6pm. Creative witnessing is an active response practice to your fellow workshop participant as they work on their solo voice with Jenni. It is like witness-learning. Each participant will have a solo session during the taster workshop and all will be witnessed in this way." I think Jenni managed to find a very good balance between following a well thought out course structure, whilst being very open to how the energy of the group might take things in a different direction." Damien. Whether you are a seasoned singer or just curious about exploring your voice, these workshops offer a fun and interactive experience. Led by an experienced instructor, you will learn simple Tai Chi exercises that help improve breath control, posture, and vocal resonance. During the workshop, you'll get the chance to explore different vocal exercises, including warm-ups, breathing techniques, and vocal improvisation. No previous experience is required, so come as you are and be ready to embrace your voice! The Vocal Tai Chi Taster Workshops will take place on February 4th, March 10th and May 5th. All Sunday afternoon sessions. The event will be held at Exchange House, a convenient and welcoming venue located in North London, a 10 minute bus ride away from Archwy and Finsbuy Park Tubes.  Don't miss this opportunity to experience the unique blend of vocal and Tai Chi practices. Join us for an afternoon of relaxation, self-expression, and vocal exploration. Book your spot now!
Title: Vocal Tai Chi Taster Workshops
Subtitle: A four hour Sunday afternoon workshop, lead by Jenni Roditi - introducing the basics of Vocal Tai Chi in an experiential session.

Refund_Policy: Contact the organiser to request a refund.
Description: A typical puppy yoga class will have approximately 6-10 puppies with around 15 participants and the puppies can range from 8-14 weeks old. Puppy yoga classes involve having puppies roaming from one mat to the next, leaping on participants, and tussling with other puppies as you try out different yoga poses. Often pups are incorporated into some of the yoga poses or they happily roam free throughout class. All puppies are borrowed from a local breeder and we find the breeders from websites such as Kennel Club or Pets4Homes. On some occasions, Puppy Yoga gives the puppies an opportunity to be adopted, if they haven‚Äôt already found their forever home. The puppies get the chance to be around other people (not just their breeder) which enhances their socialisation. In the first 3 months of a puppies life it is very important to expose your puppies to different people, new environments, sounds and smells. Puppy yoga is a safe and fun space that aids with our puppies socialisation. When you cuddle a puppy, it has psychological benefits, increasing the happy hormones: oxytocin and serotonin to the brain and lowering cortisol levels (the negative hormone) similar to when you embrace a new-born baby for the first time. This in turn with the yoga, will leave you feeling physically , mentally and emotional balanced and fulfillled. For health and safety reasons an Adult must attend and supervise the child. One adult per two children tickets purchased. Tickets non-refundable but can be redeemed against any future puppy yoga event with BarePaws Yoga Ltd.
Title: (PROMOTION) Puppy Cuddles, Yoga & Playtime
Subtitle: Come and share the puppy love and cuddles with your loved one or family/ friends. Cuddles in abundance for all guaranteed!

Description: All aboard! SalsaTrain's new launch the Merton Line each Sunday @ NEMCA 11 mins walk from Tooting Mainline Train Station. Beginners  Bachata & Beginners/Improvers Salsa classes each Sunday from 3-6pm. SalsaTrain classes have been running each Weds for over 2 years now. The classes are fun & interactive with Dominic Insta(Salsa_Legend) with over 20 years salsa experience, and Trish with 10 years teaching experience. Dominic's style is Predominately L.A. on 1/ cuban fusion. He was placed 1st in the Tropicana Tropics World Open Salsa Championship (Ama Division) 2003, has performed with a team of dancers at the 2005 UK salsa congress and placed as runner up in the European Open Salsa Championships (Cab 2007). He has also performed at the Scandinavian Salsa Congress 2009 in Sweden; as part of a team at one of the New York Salsa Congresses and instructed for many salsa promoters within the UK and Internationally. During lockdown, Dom launched his weekly music show "Sundown Salsa Live" on Mixcloud and now plays regularly on OSSR radio every Friday 10am-12pm. Trish also teaches the beginners and 2nd improvers classes on Wednesdays & will assist in teaching these classes. Lessons (45 mins long) include social practice. No partner necessary. Boarding 3pm 1st stop - 3.15-4pm Beginners Bachata 2nd stop - 4.15-5pm Beginners or Improvers Salsa (both classes run simultaneously) 3rd stop - Social Practice 5-6pm Homeward Bound 6pm ¬£10 for 1 class, ¬£12.50 for 2 classes (both including social practice). Early bird tickets for 2 classes including party train for ¬£7.50 available until 3pm each Saturday - 24 hours before SalsaTrain. Boarding from 3pm. Get your tickets via www.latindianevents.com which leads to the following eventbrite links -  (WE ALSO ACCEPT PAYMENT BY CARD ON ARRIVAL) You will be refunded or have your ticket transferred to another night providing you inform either of the contacts below by 1pm on the day you are coming. More info please contact Abs 07507634241 or Dom 07939587944 Venue details and information. https://www.nemca.org.uk/The event will take place at the NEMCA (North East Mitcham Community Association in Mitcham South London (11 mins walk from Tooting Main Line Train Station) This venue is nice and spacious and COVID friendly and has a very comfortable feel with great wooden floor for learning and dancing. There are plenty of tables and seats available for up to 60 guests. There is also free parking outside the venue and on Woodland Way. Upon arrival please come inside.You will need to show your pre paid ticket on your phone or pay by card on arrival.There is a water tank at the venue and kitchen will be available for teas/coffees.Please wear trainers or something soft for dancing on concrete. All aboard the SalsaTrain Merton Line!!!
Title: SalsaTrain's Merton Line Weekly Sunday Bachata & Salsa classes & dancing
Subtitle: Join us each Sunday afternoon for fun & engaging Bachata and Salsa classes, followed by 1 hours Social Practice on the SalsaTrain

Concessions - ¬£6 - 1/ Please arrive within 15 minutes of your slot 2/ Admission is for thirty minutes 3/ Concession tickets are for those unable to afford full price - whilst there are many wealthy students &  pensioners there are also plenty of poor adults and we want everyone to be able to visit 4/ Concession tickets are also available to people with pre-existing bar reservations .  We advise you to visit the museum after you have had your drink as you will appreciate it more. 5/ Discounted ¬£5 / ¬£2.50 concessions admission available to all on Thursdays 6/ Locals living within walking distance with proof of address may buy ¬£6 tickets on the door 7/ Due to The Adult Nature of Some of the exhibits - Dead People / Erotica etc - under 18's are only allowed in when accompanied by a parent/guardian before 5pm 8/ Admission includes a free cup of tea on request 9/ Accessibility, unfortunately, due to the historic nature of the building,  access to the museum is via a narrow spiral staircase and there is no wheelchair access, If you have any questions regarding accessibility, please contact ali@absintheparlour.com. Description: Join us moving outdoors in this beauiful SE London park because natural spaces give something to the body, to movement, the way we feel and the way we understand nature, that we are in love with and would like to share.  ‚Äã It is a format where actions or 'undoing' derive from listening to what it is we need or want at this given time in this given space. We soften the edges of what we think we need to do, adjusting our methods and exercises to what feels right and where our curiosity leads us. That may be exercises but it might also be lying in the grass, throwing back a ball to a child, cartwheeling or perceiving tiny shifts of weight on an uneven grassy ground. It is an initiative of dancers to improvise and tune with what is present through dances but we consider any kind of movement to be a dance! We consider all movement to reflect an understanding of how we make sense of ourselves and what we are with, increasingly fine tuning our attention on how movement transcends our personal body into shared rhythms, energies, breath and where gravity and space nurture a dynamic togetherness by dancing with nature. We will give a little intro to begin with but once set, it is up to you to move in any way you like. Simple, complex, still dynamic - whatever you are and bring is welcome! We invite all cultures, genders and abilities to join in to create a space of inclusivity to expand our collective story.
Title: Openly Spaced Out
Subtitle: Dance improvisation in Hilly Fields. With an introduction for newcomers at 9.30am. Meeting place Pistachios in the park cafe, out front

Description: Welcome to the Mother‚Äôs Day Special Puppy cuddles, yoga & playtime event at Barefoot Yoga & Therapy! Treat your mom to a day of relaxation and fun with adorable puppies. Join us for a unique yoga session filled with puppy cuddles and playtime. It‚Äôs the perfect way to celebrate Mother‚Äôs Day and create lasting memories. Don‚Äôt miss out on this special event! A typical puppy yoga class will have Come and share the puppy love and cuddles with your loved one or family/ friends. Cuddles in abundance for all guaranteed! approximately 6-10 puppies with around 15 participants and the puppies can range from 8-14 weeks old. Puppy yoga classes involve having puppies roaming from one mat to the next, leaping on participants, and tussling with other puppies as you try out different yoga poses. Often pups are incorporated into some of the yoga poses or they happily roam free throughout class. All puppies are borrowed from a local breeder and we find the breeders from websites such as Kennel Club or Pets4Homes. On some occasions, Puppy Yoga gives the puppies an opportunity to be adopted, if they haven‚Äôt already found their forever home. The puppies get the chance to be around other people (not just their breeder) which enhances their socialisation. In the first 3 months of a puppies life it is very important to expose your puppies to different people, new environments, sounds and smells. Puppy yoga is a safe and fun space that aids with our puppies socialisation. When you cuddle a puppy, it has psychological benefits, increasing the happy hormones: oxytocin and serotonin to the brain and lowering cortisol levels (the negative hormone) similar to when you embrace a new-born baby for the first time. This in turn with the yoga, will leave you feeling physically , mentally and emotional balanced and fulfillled. For health and safety reasons an Adult must attend and supervise the child. One adult per two children tickets purchased. Tickets non-refundable but can be redeemed against any future puppy yoga event with BarePaws Yoga Ltd.
Title: Mother‚Äôs Day Special Puppy cuddles, yoga & playtime
Subtitle: Join us for a fun-filled Mother's Day event featuring adorable puppies, relaxing yoga, and playful playtime!

Description: Join us for an afternoon of running, street art and drinks, all to raise money for Children With Cancer UK. Sunday 10 March 2024 2.30pm If you‚Äôve ever wandered around Shoreditch you won‚Äôt have failed to notice that the area is full of fascinating street art. On Sunday 10 March Leader in Running Fitness Siobhan Hagan will take you round the sights of East London to see some amazing, provocative and powerful street art, before winding back to Brew Dog for a drink. And it‚Äôs all for charity! Your ticket includes All profits go to Children With Cancer UK, the leading national children‚Äôs charity dedicated to fighting childhood cancer through high quality research. The plan 2.30pm - meet at BrewDog Shoreditch Warm up in Arnold Circus 5km running tour around Shoreditch street art 3.30/4pm - back to BrewDog for drinks, nibbles and a natter Where will we run? We‚Äôll do roughly 5km around Shoreditch and you‚Äôll see lots of fab street art. We‚Äôll take a pause, catch our breath, and you‚Äôll learn more about each piece. And take lots of cool photos! How fast will we run? Whatever you like. It will be steady enough to be conversational and for everyone to feel comfortable and no-one will be left behind. We‚Äôll meet at 2.30pm and our table for drinks is at 3,30pm, but if we‚Äôre earlier or later that‚Äôs fine! Will there be a bag drop? Yes, we can leave our bags at BrewDog. But neither we or the venue take any responsibility for them, so don‚Äôt bring family heirlooms and the like. The space isn‚Äôt massive, so come ready to run as much as possible. Will we warm up? Of course! Siobhan is a Leader in Running Fitness so will do a structured warm up and cool down so we‚Äôre ready to go. Where will we drink? Our host venue is BrewDog Shoreditch, 51 Bethnal Green Road, London, E1 6LA. What will we eat and drink? You can have a medium house wine, a beer/lager, a single house spirit and mixer, or a soft drink. We‚Äôll also get some snacks to refuel. What if I want more food and drink? Bring your card and buy some! Where does the money go? In 2024 Siobhan Hagan will be running 2 marathons in 2 weeks. Brighton on 7 April and London on 21 April to raise money for Children with Cancer UK. They have funded over 300 research projects leading to the development of better, kinder treatments and significantly contributing to survival rates which we‚Äôve seen improve from 67% to 85.2%. From ‚Äòamazing days out‚Äô to funding accommodation close to hospitals, theywork with partners to ensure families have the emotional and financial support they need, allowing them to focus on what matters most ‚Äì their child. They shine a spotlight on childhood cancer to improve outcomes for thousands of children and young people across the UK. See how Siobhan‚Äôs training is getting on here. Please note, that even though we are going slowly and you have run leaders with you, we can not accept any responsibility. Please ensure you are fit enough to run, and be smart about crossing roads and getting around London.
Title: Stride, sip & street art for Children With Cancer UK
Subtitle: Join us for an afternoon of running, street art and drinks, all to raise money for Children With Cancer UK.

Description: Welcome to Conductor: An art exhibition featuring the incredible work of female South Asian diaspora artists! Step into a dynamic fusion of cultures and identities, where the vibrant voices of diaspora South Asian women resonate with strength and resilience! Join us for an exhilarating celebration of art and diversity as we transform a cozy caf√© into a vibrant art gallery for our International Women's Day Art Exhibition, spotlighting the extraordinary talents of Diaspora South Asian women. Prepare to embark on a captivating journey through a kaleidoscope of artistic expressions, where tradition meets innovation and heritage intertwines with contemporary narratives. From evocative paintings to immersive installations, each artwork pulsates with the energy of cultural heritage and the universal experiences of womanhood. As we commemorate International Women's Day, let us come together to celebrate the resilience, creativity, and unyielding spirit of Diaspora South Asian women. Let us honor their contributions to the global art landscape and amplify their voices in a world that is ever-evolving and increasingly interconnected. As part of this immersive experience, we're thrilled to offer a unique opportunity to engage with art firsthand through an exclusive art workshop, completely free of charge. Led by talented Diaspora South Asian women artists, participants will delve into the captivating world of lino printing, discovering the intricate process behind this timeless technique. Unleash your creativity, experiment with textures and patterns, and create your own masterpiece under the expert guidance of our seasoned instructors. Don't miss this extraordinary event that promises to ignite your senses, provoke your thoughts, and inspire your soul. Bring the incredible women in your life to join us for an unforgettable evening of art, culture, and empowerment as we celebrate the vibrant tapestry of Diaspora South Asian women's creativity and resilience. Mark your calendars and be part of this transformative experience in our transformed caf√©-turned-gallery! Tickets: ¬£15 (Lino workshop included)
Title: IWD Art Gallery: Showcasing  South Asian artists from around the world
Subtitle: Celebrate the art of  South Asian diaspora women on International Women's Day at our caf√©-turned-gallery.

Description: Agatha Christie Walking Tour of London! A 2-hour walk that will allow you to look at London through the prism of the inspiring and full-of-interesting-twists life of one of the best-selling authors of all time, the undisputed Queen of Crime, Agatha Christie. During the walk, you will learn how and why 4-year-old Agatha taught herself to read, where she gained her knowledge of poisons, why her first book was almost her last, and why in 1962, in an exclusive 5-star hotel in London, you could see a half-ton mouse trap! Description: This circle is part of an international network of circles via The Wild Woman Project (thewildwomanproject.com) WHAT IS A WILD WOMAN PROJECT COLLECTIVE Each trained facilitator guides her Circle at New Moon time. In Circle we explore a new theme each month via Creative Visualization, Journaling, Sharing & Ritual. Each and every New Moon, women all over the world, walk out of circle with a powerful & specific intention for her life- an intention that came from the depths of her own heart, through the conduit of the circle journey. This beautiful practice is a dose of sacred ceremony & heart felt strategy that has the power to transform the life of each woman who takes the journey. Here at The Wild Woman Project, we have seen the most awe-inspiring transformations happen as a result of this special practice, especially amongst our Circle Leaders. Our aim is to foster: Each Circle is a co-creation between the Circle Leader, the local community of attendees and the Project itself. Each month we have a collective theme & visualization based on the astrological placement of the New Moon. Each Circle Leader then creates her circle space & ritual, in her own way, with her own wisdom & instincts. In this way, we stand side by side as a global community, Circle Leaders are Wild (unique in their expression) and deeply connected to community.
Title: New Moon Circle
Subtitle: Expect: Meditation, Intention Setting, Journaling and Sharing,  based on  the New Moon and monthly astrological theme.

Description: Violent Divinity: Immersive Audiovisual Exhibtion An act that introduces historicity and ruptures the archetypical presence, as perceived by the audience, entails an experience of violence and birth. Inspired by Siteng‚Äôs debut art pop EP, which features a violently nurturing subaquatic world, the immersive audiovisual experience, Violent Divinity, summons an underwater bloom of Asian artists. As artist/scenographer, JINGYI curated a biotically diverse wetland in a living home space. Encompassing photography, experimental films, performance arts, and interactive installations, the artworks highlight the power in acknowledging & transforming battle scars into art and thriving in a hostile environment. Siteng and JINGYI also ensure that the resonance will be further amplified by the Scene to create ripples through space and time. With a splashing multi-sensory opening performance, Violent Divinity will be followed by a five-day exhibition. The opportunity created to champion Asian artists will ripple far into the global art scene. The exhibition features works from 8 interdisciplinary artists of Asian origins: Siteng, JINGYI, Flo Yuting Zhu, Alya Kautsaranti, Julia D√®ng H√†nz√∫, Runxuan Yang, Aashfaria Anwar, and Luyin Cao. The exhibition is generously supported by Wired4Music, Youth Music, and LuckyPot. Contact sitenmusic@outlook.com and jingyi_studio@outlook.com for inquiries.
Title: Violent Divinity: Immersive Audiovisual Exhibition
Subtitle: An exhibition featuring 8 Asian Artists' eclectic works ‚Äì inspired by Siteng's debut art pop EP.

Description: Grab your 241 tickets for the hottest witch tour in town! Are you ready to learn historical facts? Are you ready to be thoroughly entertained? Join your characterful witch guide and hear the true historical tales of suspected London witches across the ages. Witness fascinating pieces of London history along the way too; hear secrets of Southwark Cathedral, The Golden Hinde, The Globe Theatre, Millennium Bridge and so very much more await on this character led walking tour. Starting by the infamous London Bridge your friendly costumed witch guide will lead you across Southwark's Southbank‚Äôs cobbles, seamlessly weaving history with vibrant storytelling. Widen your eyes to the tales of London‚Äôs real witches as you uncover the truth about the likes of Nicholas Culpepper ‚Äì people‚Äôs herbalist or bad boy herb doctor? Was Elizabeth Barton really that gifted? What about Jinny Bingham, did she deserve the nickname ‚ÄúMother Damnable"? And did Old Joan Butts get off Scot-Free? You make your own mind up on this magical educational journey to the past. You will wind your way down Winchester Walk, bob around the edges of Borough Market, clatter your way down Clink Street and buzz down Bankside. An intriguing Tudor ship and ruined Winchester Palace cannot be missed along the way. Your faithful guide will happily point out a certain Elizabethan dramatic playhouse as well as the breathtakingly iconic landmarks across the river including the majestic St. Paul‚Äôs Cathedral of course‚Ä¶ In an experience that brings together true stories, history, and a wisdom that we can learn from our terrible ways of the past, you are sure to fall in love with this historic small part of the city and be enthralled by London‚Äôs witchy chronicles. You may even see some famous filming locations from Harry Potter along the way! Don‚Äôt miss the chance to join London‚Äôs wonderful Witches & History Magical Walking Tour and see things as you never have before‚Ä¶ *Please note this is an outdoor walking tour so dress for the weather, my dears.
Title: 2-4-1 London Witches & History Walking Tour
Subtitle: Experience London‚Äôs wicked history and see famous sights on this spellbindingly unique walking tour, led by a bewitching guide!

Description: Experience a transformative evening of sound healing with a soothing sound bath to welcome in this new moon.About the New Moon in PiscesWater sign Pisces is the last sign of the zodiac, so the Pisces New Moon is all about checking in on our emotions before the astrological new year begins in Aries season.This particular lunar event is also a good time to set some intentions. The sign of Pisces is ruled by Neptune, planet of dreams and illusions, so let your imagination loose. This new moon is the perfect astrological event for manifesting your dream life!. What to expect?We will begin the session by silently setting our individual intentions for the sound bath. This allows us to get the most out of the power of sound healing as we are able to individually focus on what we want to achieve from the session.Followed by an immersive sound journey dedicated to raising vibrations and showing yourself the love you deserve. We will dive deep with a powerful sound journey, taking time to re centre, re align and re calibrate. We use a mixture of Gong, crystal bowls and chimes to sooth you into a state of deep relaxation. We will close the space with oracle cards and a herbal tea.Evening highlightsIt is our absolute pleasure to offer you this safe space for you to take some well deserved time for you to rest, relax, realign and to release.1. Herbal Tea2. Intention setting3. New Moon guided meditation4. New Moon Soothing Sound Bath5. Oracle Cards & AffirmationsFeel free to message me any questions you have via info@theselflovelab.co.uk or via instagram @theselflovelab.co.ukDOORS CLOSE at 7pm - entry will not be permitted after this.LIMITED TICKET AVAILABILITY.. We cannot wait to see you there! Our beautiful venue. We will be transforming this venue into a beautiful candlelit room filled with high vibrational magic. About Zehra Zehra is a qualified sound therapist and the founder of the self love lab. Her sound has made it into the pages of british vogue and she has recently hosted a sound bath for 1000 people as part of roxie nafousi' manifest workshop. She created The Self Love Lab, a leading London based wellness community with the healing benefits of sound healing at our core. She combines the powerful benefits of sound with other healing modalities to bring you meditation, creativity and education based experiences.  She cannot wait to welcome you all. Getting to the space by tube: Jubilee Line - Canning Town, 4 min walk DLR - Canning Town or Royal Victoria, 4 min walk Elizabeth Line - Custom House, 15 min walk or 3 min bus
Title: New Moon in Pisces Soothing Sound Bath Evening
Subtitle: Experience a transformative evening of sound healing with a soothing sound bath to welcome in this transformative new moon.

Description: Sites, statues and memorials Discover the compelling stories of women who shaped the course of history through their courage, political stances, personal rivalries and friendships. From the suffragettes who fought tirelessly for voting rights to the trailblazing nurses who revolutionised healthcare, each stop along the way offers a nuanced look at the complexities of power and influence. By the end of the tour, you'll walk away with a newfound appreciation for the diverse perspectives and contributions of women throughout history. Whether you are a history enthusiast, a lover of London's hidden gems, or simply curious to learn more, join us for an unforgettable exploration into the heart of Westminster's female influence. See London from a new female perspective and be part of this empowering journey through time. Join us for an experience that challenges, uplifts, and excites. Description: NET DRESS THE MASTERCLASS You will join a small group of 5 participants, your macrame teacher Violetta and her assistant. Your VIITTA Masterclass will begin with a short group meditation followed by a Connection Game creating a safe creative space where you can be your authentic self. Violetta will teach you how to use macrame knots to create sustainable fashion items. The class is beginner friendly as well as a great opportunity for those who want to further develop their macrame skills. All the materials, lunch and drinks will be included. You can choose the colour of the rope and accessories for your garment on the day. You will leave home with a gorgeous garment that fits your body perfectly and reflects your personality. VIITTA masterclass workshops are not only about the incredible results at the end, but the creative journey itself. The repetitive and meditative process of tying knots, self-reflection and shared energy in the room makes it an unforgettable, mindful experience that supports creativity as well as mental health. AGENDA FOR THE DAY 10:00 to 10:15 - Guests arrive in E15, London (the exact address will be emailed after the deposit payment has been received) 10:15 to 10:30 - Group Meditation 10:30 to 10:45 - Connection Game 10:45 to 13:00 - Macrame Skills 13:00 to 14:00 - Lunch 14:00 to 17:00 - Macrame Skills 17:00 to 18:00 - Celebration with drinks, photos and videos. REVIEWS After taking VIITTA Macrame Masterclasses, Violetta‚Äôs guests say: ‚ÄúI enjoyed the energy, the feminine get together, the fact that Violetta is encouraging inexperienced people with macrame to create something amazing and complex. You have motivated me even more to follow my dream and make my creative work a side job one day.‚Äù Tanja ‚ÄúYou inspire all around you. Much like the art of macrame, you have created knots and weaves and patterns amongst us all, interconnecting and weaving us around you so in turn we do the same to those around us.‚Äù Maria ‚ÄúA really fun day learning the art of macrame. It was fantastic to be able to create my very own unique Freya dress just through using different knotting techniques. It‚Äôs very intricate and takes time but the end results are very rewarding‚Ä¶ and it was so much fun so I‚Äôve booked to take more classes! Highly recommended!‚Äù Elizabeth ‚ÄúIt was a unique experience, gentle, fun with beautiful moments of comfortable silences, which is in itself incredibly rare. Violetta is also an incredibly patient tutor, I am dyspraxic and it takes a few tries to get something right‚Äù ‚ÄúI‚Äôve always wanted to learn macrame and I learn better when someone is showing me so making the dress was fantastic. I also learnt that if you want something you should always work towards it and not give up on your dreams‚Äù Niki ‚ÄúI enjoyed everything about the day. Each part was considered and thought through, starting the day with breathing exercises and connection game was beautiful. The directions were very clear and it was nice to just zone out with the macrame!‚Äù Ella ‚ÄúVioletta was so welcoming along with her interns. The meditation at the start really got you in the right frame of mind to learn. Then the teaching and lunch was amazing. Everyone was so nice and it was so relaxed you could be yourself.‚Äù Niki ‚ÄúI enjoyed everything! The people, the energy and the beautiful dress we created.‚Äù Sybilla
Title: Macrame Masterclass Workshop in London - Net Dress
Subtitle: You will leave home with a finished macrame net dress, sense of accomplishment, new skills and friendships.

Description: Join us at the National Gallery in Trafalgar Square, London, for an immersive journey into the Impressionist movement. In this visit, through the masterpieces of three pivotal artists in the history of the movement ‚Äì Camille Pissarro, Claude Monet, and Georges Seurat ‚Äì, we will explore the relationship between the Impressionism and the scientific thinking of its time, its engagement with a newly established urban pathos, and its disruptive stance in relation to a historical artistic production, laying the groundwork for what would later be called Modern Art. This visit is also an opportunity to visit (or revisit) some of these artworks unvealing stories hidden beneath their brushstockes, composing relations between these creations and its impacts up to nowadays. General Information: Who is your guide tour? Paloma Durante holds degree in Fine Arts, with advanced studies in performance in Visual Arts. She works as an artist, educator, independent curator, and editor. She is originally from S√£o Paulo, Brazil, and has worked in various cultural and artistic institutions in the city, such as the S√£o Paulo Biennial Foundation, SESC-SP, the Ema Klabin Foundation, among others, producing educational programs for diverse audiences. Twice, she has been selected for the "New Perspectives" award, promoted by MIS-SP, for innovative projects in the field of art and education. She has also received awards for the production of independent publications and participation in art residencies. She contributed to the programming of the City Heritage Journey for three years, organizing activities that involved discussions about the right to the city and collective memory through guided walks in S√£o Paulo's historic center. This experience led her to develop her own project of meetings and walks to discuss arts and culture, now expanding its footprint to the city of London.
Title: Art on Site:  An Insight Into Impressionist Movement
Subtitle: Understanding the Impressionist Movement and its poetics by the visual analysis of selected artworks present at National Gallery

Description: Come join us for a relaxed workshop and learn how to play simple southern African folk songs on the African marimba from Zimbabwe. We usually do a bit of singing as well to go with each song. The workshop is open to everyone regardless of musical ability. Only 8 places available. Workshop date: Sunday 11th February Time: 12:15 - 13:15 Location: St Peters North Community Centre, 1 Marian Place, London E2 9AX Cost: ¬£10 About Marimba Full of buzzing sound and energy, the marimba is a wonderful instrument to play. A typical Zimbabwean marimba ensemble is made up of soprano, tenor, baritone and bass marimbas. They are acoustic instruments, making them easy to set up, and they are played using two sticks. Zimbabwean marimbas came into extistance in the 1960s at Kwanongoma College of African Music in Bulawayo, Zimbabwe, which specialised in African music and teacher training. The marimba was developed as a uniquely African instrument for instruction. Today the instruments are played across southern Africa. About Otto Otto Gumaelius is a London based, Botswana raised, percussionist specialising in the Kwanongoma marimba and mbira nyunga nyunga of southern Africa. He writes and performs with his band Otto & The Mutapa Calling, and teaches music from Zimbabwe, South Africa and Botswana through his cultural arts and events company, Taste of Southern Africa. He is also a published author with a 1st Class Master of Arts Honours Degree in International Management.
Title: Play the African Xylophone (Marimba from Zimbabwe)
Subtitle: Learn how to play some simple southern African folk songs on the African marimba from Zimbabwe.

Description: Come join us on this relaxed workshop and learn how to play some simple southern African folk songs on the African Kalimba (Mbira Nyunga Nyunga) from Zimbabwe. Each workshop includes a bit of call and response singing. The workshop is open to everyone regardless of musical ability. Only 14 places available. Workshop date: Sunday 11th February Time: 11:00 - 12:00 Location: St Peters North Community Centre, 1 Marian Place, London E2 9AX Cost: ¬£10 About Mbira Nyunga Nyunga The mbira instrument belongs to an ancient family of lamellophones played by the Shona people of Zimbabwe. Traditionally, the mbira is used as a spiritual pathway connecting the living to their ancestors. However, in recent times, the mbira has been adapted into popular music by musicians such as Thomas Mapfumo and Stella Chiweshe. We teach using a contemporary adaptation of the traditional mbira. This version is called mbira nyunga nyunga and it is a 15 key mbira that was introduced in the 1960‚Äôs in Bulawayo, Zimbabwe, based on a type of kalimba played in neighbouring Mozambique. With a beautiful, soothing sound, the mbira nyunga nyunga has captivated players around the world. Famous players of the instrument include Chiwoniso Maraire and Hope Masike. About Otto Otto Gumaelius is a London based, Botswana raised, percussionist specialising in the Kwanongoma marimba and mbira nyunga nyunga of southern Africa. He writes and performs with his band Otto & The Mutapa Calling, and teaches music from Zimbabwe, South Africa and Botswana through his cultural arts and events company, Taste of Southern Africa. He is also a published author with a 1st Class Master of Arts Honours Degree in International Management.
Title: Play the African Kalimba (Mbira Nyunga Nyunga of Zimbabwe)
Subtitle: Learn how to play some simple southern African folk songs on the African Kalimba (Mbira Nyunga Nyunga) from Zimbabwe.

Description: Join me Sunday 10th of March 16.00 - 18:00pm at the gorgeous The_Space Studio for a special Mothers Day and New Super Moon for a SOUND JOURNEY featuring the Venus Gong üåπ with ROSE tea, Rose Sacred Oil & and a mindful, distressing, ROSE FACE MASSAGE RITUAL. Share this special time with your mum, daughter or come by yourself or some girlfriends! You don't have to be a mother to join, come and celebrate yourself, your mum, grandma, the Mother Goddess or the Earth Mother. The energy of the ceremony will be peaceful, caring and nurturing‚Ä¶ a much-needed precious time that will leave you radiating a calm presence. We‚Äôll share a tension releasing and rejuvenating Rose face self-massage, Rose tea and a resetting sound healing bath immersed in the love frequencies of crystal singing bowls, gongs - featuring the Venus Gong- flutes and chimes. Looking forward to this blissful intimate evening of relaxation to calm your mind, body and face! Mothers Day Rose Sound Journey & Face Massage Ritual to calm your mind, rebalance, root into Mother Earth and receive the loving embrace of the Great Mother with Venus Gong, Rose Tea, Rose Sacred Oil anointing and a mindful distressing Rose face massage for extra pampering. WHAT TO EXPECT The evening will be a multisensory experience starting with a meditative connection with your breath, heart and with Rose. We will experience the loving beauty of Rose Tea and commune with the Spirit of Rose as we prepare to indulge in a wonderfully relaxing face self-massage ritual with Veronica's 100% natural Rose Toner and Rose Beauty Oil. You will be invited to quietly tune into yourself and set an intention as we anoint ourselves with Rose Sacred Oil. Guided into a meditative state, you will be immersed in a sound bath with the gongs, including the beautiful loving divine feminine energy of the VENUS gong, crystal singing bowls, flutes and other instruments. Re-emerging from the sound journey we will collectively acknowledge the medicine of our shared experience and close the circle with a giving of thanks and a grounding of energies. üåπüåπüåπüåπü•Äü•Äü•Ä ABOUT ROSE Embodying the Mother Archetype, Rose energy is nurturing, comforting, calming, reassuring and ultimately loving. Emanating a voluptuous sensual scent, Rose, like the goddess Isis and Venus, is the manifestation of love and fully embodies the Divine Feminine and Divine Mother on Earth. She reconnects us with the Mother Goddess so that we can embody her qualities, transform anything that keeps us separated from ourselves and reawakens our healing power. Rose oil makes a powerful anointing oil for the energetic heart centre. To learn about Rose Sacred Oil https://sothistemple.com/sacredoilssoulessence/rose ABOUT THE VENUS PLANETARY GONG* The Venus gong resonates at the approximate musical note of A, associated with our 3rd Eye Chakra (or 1st Eye) inspiring creativity and invoking the spirit of feminine energy. Venus/Isis is the embodiment of Divine Love and the Divine Feminine principles. When we are bathed in a sound bath with the atmospheric and soothing Venus gong, we are compelled to drop our protective armour and surrender in the arms of the Great Mother. Its harmonious resonance is joyfull, loving and compassionate, helping to drop into a state of acceptance and surrendering. Restore the frequencies of gratitude and appreciation and allowing the divine plan to unfold with trust in the flow of life we rediscover the Joy of life and creative inspiration *Planetary gongs are made using the calculations of Hans Cousto (The Cosmic Octave) to match the frequencies of the sun, moon, and planets; each gong is tuned to produce the corresponding frequency. REVIEWS FROM PREVIOUS EVENTS "I had the most beautiful experience last night! The sound bath was extraordinary and I have gone from feeling extremely uptight to at peace and reconnected to my body! I am so grateful to Veronica! She has SUCH a beautiful gift! I‚Äôm feel so blessed she is sharing it! I can‚Äôt wait to do another session! And am excited to use my new oil and toner! Absolute gifts! Thank you!" Amy Whittle, Performing Artist /Singer "Veronica‚Äôs sound healing journey into the heart with rose was simply put, magical. Her natural way with sound, sacred oils and her presence makes everyone feel completely at ease and welcome. It was an incredibly powerful, calming meditation, much like her beautiful facials and skincare range-revitalising. I couldn‚Äôt recommend her highly enough!" Jess O'Tolle, Filmaker/Actress See reviews ABOUT YOUR HOST Veronica offers unique multisensory soundscape experiences bringing the healing power of sound, scent and art into ritual and ceremony. In her Sacred Sound Ceremonies, she integrates the ancient Temple Tradition of Sacred Oils and Plant Spirit Healing, connecting to the spirit medicine and soul essence of plants, providing direct communication for inner healing work, self-knowledge, strong intuition and profound alignment. With two decades of experience in the Holistic Healing Arts, Veronica's multidisciplinary work focuses on facilitating the process of self-healing, guided by an intuitive, holistic and heart-centred approach. With a deep insight into the face-mind-heart connection, aromatic healing and sacred sound, Veronica creates profound therapeutic experiences harmonising the emotions, centring the spirit and helping you to realign with your true self. Veronica is a visionary artist Spirit inspired working with the Egyptian Shamanic Mysteries, and a multidisciplinary intuitive healer combining elements of Alchemical and Sekhem energy healing, Shamanism, Aromatic and Reflex Oriental Medicine in her Sound Healing Baths and individual sessions. She is the creatrix of Sothis Sacred Oils and founder of Sothis Temple where Sacred Art, Sacred Scents and Sacred Sounds meet in unison to expand consciousness and nourish the soul, to nurture healing and spiritual growth. www.sothistemple.com. L earn more about Veronica Nilah https://sothistemple.com/my-journey
Title: Mothers Day & New SuperMoon : Rose Sound Journey + Face Massage Ritual
Subtitle: Nurturing time for mothers and all women who birth dreams. Calm your mind and rejuvenate with the warm embrace of Rose + Sound Healing Bath

Description: Think you ‚Äòcan‚Äôt draw‚Äô? So, what? Collage art is all made up. As a self-taught artist, I am confident I can guide you through nerves, anxiety and self-judgement to focus your mind and create freely. We can collage in-person using vibrant African print textiles or you can join me online using my fancy print-it-yourself paper pack and trust me, you will surprise yourself with your artistic expression. My current workshops are called ‚ÄúFree to Be‚Äù and are curated to restore, be playful and explore your inner world. Your sense of curiosity, nerves, experimentation, trauma and authentic self are welcome and I hold a judgement-free space for expression. ‚ÄúIn your workshop I reconnected to myself - your art class is a gift for the soul!‚Äù - J.R.M, Workshop Participant What to expect Each workshop includes: Who are you? What do you feel? What do you desire? Explore your identities, your dreams and reimagine yourself through art making. I offer a Pay What You Can model to allow us to support access for all. Two bursary spaces are held for people who experience financial hardship, disabled, Black and global majority, queer, women, Non Binary folk and working class people will be prioritised. Contact me on hello@birungikawooyaart.com to donate to the bursary or apply for a free workshop space. About the artist: Birungi Kawooya Birungi Kawooya is a collage artist and art tutor researching ways of being well in community, inspired by nature, Black feminists and Afro somatic movement. She creates using paper, paint, sculpture, natural fibres and batik indigenous to Uganda. Birungi has a strong collaborative art practice and makes artwork informed by community engagement. The World Reimagined and Kensington and Chelsea Art Week commissioned her to lead community workshops to inform designs for a 1.9 m globe sculpture and a 25 m long mural, respectively. With a focus on promoting mental well-being, Birungi leads Mindful African art programmes and creates spaces to help people work through anxiety, stimulate their imagination and connect to vibrant African textile designs. Birungi has led online and in-person art workshops for UAL, Black Mind, Sheffield Maternity Cooperative, Royal Borough of Greenwich and Peckham Platform. With the support of Njabala Foundation, 32¬∞ East - Ugandan Arts Trust and the Arts Council England, Birungi explored natural fibres during a five-month residency in Uganda. The artworks portray themes of trauma resolution, time travel, well-being through self-portraiture and sculptural installations inviting womxn to rest. She has artwork installed in Peckham Square and Freston Road and has exhibited at the New Art Gallery Walsall, the Portico Library, the Hastings Contemporary, the World Reimagined, Hammersmith BID, Mediacom, the Collective Makers, CasildeArt, Black Women Art Network, and Simply Gorgeous salon.
Title: Free to Be: Mindful African Art Class
Subtitle: Join Birungi Kawooya in a judgement-free zone to restore, be playful and explore your inner world through African print textiles.

Description: Soul of Spring SoNoteProduction will delight all music lovers with a concert at the Marylebone Theatre on Mother's Day, 10 th of March, titled "Soul of Spring". Our spring concert will immerse you in the bright and emotional world of opera. Favourite arias by Handel, Mozart, Puccini and Bizet, moving waltzes by Chopin and Johann Strauss and bravura marches will be performed by the charming duo Maria Danishvar (soprano) and Irina Davydova (piano). Each will uplift everyone's mood on this magical spring evening. In the second part of the concert, there will be works by Tchaikovsky, Rachmaninoff, Gershwin, Bernstein and popular songs by the unique Edith Piaf. Throughout the evening and specifically the interval, you have the chance to embrace the beauty of artwork as well - with magnificent works by the incredible  Vincent Berquez and LuSee displayed around the theatre. We look forward to seeing you at our concert 10th of March at 6.30pm at Marylebone theatre.
Title: SOUL OF SPRING - Celebrating Mother's Day! Children go free.

Description: Join us for a fun art workshop! Led by professional artist and children's book writer/illustrator Gizem Gozde Ucar, experiment with brushes and paints and create fun portraits. This will be a great child and parent experience for Mother‚Äôs Day as these amazing handmade creations can be the perfect Mother‚Äôs Day gift! In this workshop, children and parents will learn the basics of acrylic paints and Gizem will teach how to draw a portrait step-by-step and will guide you through in your individual paintings. This is a great opportunity for children to discover the artist within themselves in an extremely fun and creative way. üìÖ Date: 10th Marchüïí Time: 12:30 - 13:30 / 14:00 - 15:00üìç Location: People's Park Tavern, E9 7BT üé® Parents do not need to stay as this is a drop-off workshop but you are welcome to join too! Children will get to experiment with paints and brushes to roam free with their imagination. When they hold the brush and wear the red berets, they will feel like true artists! Who knows, this might be the workshop that will uncover their talents and lifelong passion for art! You don‚Äôt need to have any prior painting experience, this workshop is perfect for beginners. The talented artist Gizem will teach the basics of acrylic paint and how to use the tools so that you can explore your creative side. She will be there to help and guide you along the way. All painting materials will be provided: high-quality paints, brushes, canvases and easels. And each participant will also get to wear a red artist beret so that they can feel every bit of the artists they are! The duration of the workshop is approximately 1 hour. This event is suitable for adults and children who are over 4 years old. You can have some alone time and enjoy your drinks at the pub. This is a drop-off workshop for 4+ children. Children aged 4 and under can join too, but they must be accompanied by a parent or guardian throughout the duration of the event. One ticket will get you one canvas & easel, and painting materials. If the parent wishes to paint a canvas alongside their children, they will need to buy another ticket. At the end of the event, you will get to take your unique creations home with you! Your perfect gift for Mother‚Äôs Day will be ready! The workshop is run by a professional artist and children‚Äôs book writer and illustrator Gizem Gozde Ucar. Her recent works were exhibited in London, Manchester, Serbia and Greece. She has been doing workshops and events for children and adults for over 10 years. She is looking forward to welcoming you all at The People‚Äôs Park Tavern to have a day full of art, fun and laughter! The event will take place in the beautiful Greenhaus at The People's Park Tavern. Don‚Äôt miss this opportunity to celebrate this special day in a special way!
Title: Portrait Painting - Child & Parent: Mother's Day Special
Subtitle: A creative workshop for children and adults! You will learn the basics of portrait painting, have fun and paint on canvases!

Description: Have you ever felt the need to explore your inner self and experience profound spiritual growth? If so, you'll be intrigued by KAP - Kundalini Activation Process. Founded by Venant Wong, KAP offers a unique journey towards awakening the Kundalini energy within you, leading to non-dual states of consciousness. Unlike other practices that require personal willpower, KAP is about surrender, not effort. KAP distinguishes itself from practices like Kundalini yoga, tantra, and chi gong by offering a direct energy transmission. It's akin to Shakti pat and requires only one thing ‚Äì the ability to let go and receive. KAP gently activates energy centers, from the crown to the root chakra, releasing blockages and fostering deeper connections with yourself, others, and higher states of consciousness. This intelligent energy adapts to your specific needs in the moment, offering a unique and personal experience. Every KAP session is an individual journey. Some participants laugh, cry, dance, or have profound realizations. Spontaneous movements can occur, and with continued exposure, a transformative rewiring of the brain and central nervous system takes place. Common signs of Kundalini awakening are regularly experienced. However, it's not about what happens during the session; it's about the profound unblocking of your energy centers and your deeper connection to intuition and authenticity. In our open class, immerse yourself in a carefully curated playlist of enchanting music while you lie down on a comfortable mat, close your eyes, and let go. The KAP facilitator will guide the energy transmission, occasionally touching different chakra/meridian points on your body. Experiences can Include: Energetic sensations Visual experiences, from an active third eye to astral journeys Emotional release (Crying, laughing, anger, sadness, joy, and bliss) Kinaesthetic movements, stretches, and yoga poses Blissful states KAP offers a wide range of benefits, from spiritual growth to healing mind, body, and soul. Participants often report: Deepening of consciousness Removal of energetic blocks Connection to higher self and source Relief from anxiety and depression Overall well-being Sarvenaz, trained by KAP Academy, is thrilled to guide you on this extraordinary journey. Comfortable clothing Avoid eating heavily for 3 hours prior to the session (a light snack like fruit is fine) Refrain from alcohol or substances 24 hours before the session If you prefer, bring a yoga mat; otherwise, one will be provided for you. PLEASE NOTE: KAP is NOT advised for individuals prone to mania, delusions, psychosis, or epilepsy, as well as for pregnant women in their third trimester. https://www.kapacademy.com/kap-academy/ Sarvenaz Elevation Website Email: sarvenazelevation@gmail.com
Title: New Moon Kundalini Activation Process -KAP Session London
Subtitle: Awaken Your Essence: A Journey of Self-Discovery with KAP - Where Magic Meets Transformation.

Description: Aho Community is honoured to invite you to a collaboration with Rakesh ‚ÄúRootsman Rak‚Äù. Join us in community over two weekends at Berkeley Farm in Hainault to connect to the land and bring you the knowledge and hands on experience to design and create a forest garden. ¬† Rakesh ‚ÄúRootsman Rak‚Äù is an experienced permaculture and forest gardening designer and teacher. He will coordinate all participants to help make a real forest garden design for Berkeley Farm. You will learn his design tools, learning the many tools Rakesh has in his permaculture and forest gardening toolbox. ¬† We are all too well aware of the challenges the world faces, especially in our food growing systems. This course shows us how to address many of these issues by making low maintenance, nutrient dense, biodiverse rich food growing systems know as food forests or forest gardening. We will also add many additional features to the design using Permaculture design. ¬† So if you are interested in ecology; helping to increase biodiversity; sequester carbon; manage greenhouse gases; cool your surroundings while growing nutrient dense foods, soaps, medicines, crafting materials, etc but with minimum effort i.e. where nature does the work, and enriches itself, then this course is for you. ¬† First Weekend: Designing forest gardens9th-10th March 2024, 9am-5pm ¬† Imagine your garden or community space looking as lovely as a woodland edge. Imagine that on top of looking wonderfully wild, it produces an abundance of nutrient dense food and will ultimately need very little digging, weeding, manual watering or pest control - all in harmony with animals and other beings (eco friendly and vegan). This is ‚Äòan edible forest garden‚Äô. ¬† Forest gardening is a way of growing food where nature does most of the work for you. Modelled on natural woodland, crops are grown in different layers from high and medium sized canopy to roots, ground cover and climbers. And its not just food and medicine you will get from the forest garden, there are many more yields. ¬† Through careful planning plants are chosen which have beneficial effects on each other, attract beneficial insects and create a healthy biodiverse rich system that maintains its own fertility. Once established, your main task will be harvesting! The course is designed so you will learn how to make a forest garden anywhere, including your own home, while also making a real design for Berkeley Farm. ¬† Over the 2 days you will learn about the basics of designing a forest garden. You will get to understand- How to select the right plants for your environment- Where to place them to ensure they thrive- How to ensure you have the right nutrients cycling to ensure good crops- History of forest gardening- Why make a food forest- Layout of a forest garden- Multifunctional pathways- Creating abundance and resilience- Low maintenance food growing- Patterns in nature for forest gardens- Understanding and maximising edge You will put all of this into action by helping to design a real forest garden for the farm. Second Weekend: Permaculture Design16th-17th March 2024 9am-5pm ¬† Over the 2 days you will learn about the basics of permaculture design. You will get to understand- Permaculture ethics and how to use them to make ethical choices- Permaculture principles and how to use them to strengthen designs- A design methodology to simplify and make designs easier and more robust- Water management strategies- Soil improvement strategies- Land management strategies- Low maintenance food growing systems ¬† You will put all of this into action by helping to design a real forest garden for Berkeley Farm. ¬† The course will be led by Rakesh ‚ÄúRootsman Rak‚Äù - experienced Permaculture designer, teacher and Forest Garden specialist, yoga teacher and homeopath. He has been growing food since he was a child, and has been designing and teaching edible landscaping, permaculture, forest gardening, etc since 2009. Rakesh has designed and implemented forest gardens from small-scale private gardens and schools, to farms, community gardens, communal nature gardens, as well as helping design and implement forest gardens for various eco villages. ¬† Location: Berkeley FarmManor Rd, Lambourne End,Romford, RM4 1NH,United Kingdom ¬† Boots and appropriate clothing requested, bring your own lunch. Hot soup, teas, tools, shelter and a sacred fire provided. A notepad is recommended. ¬† We want this course to be accessible and feel a reasonable price of ¬£220 for the¬†two weekend¬†course towards meeting the needs of the facilitator(s) is acceptable ¬† But if you are on low income and wish to attend please contact darenellis@aho.community to discuss a concession price or if you can only attend 1¬†of the weeknds this is possible at a cost of ¬£120. ¬† If you jave any questions or would like to contact RakeshFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/rootsmanrakEmail: rakeshaji@gmail.com
Title: Forest Garden & Permaculture Design Course
Subtitle: Join us in community at Berkeley Farm to connect to the land and bring you the knowledge and experience to design and create a forest garden

Skateboarding has always been a place of creation, resistance and solidarity. We would like to take a clear stand to show our support to the Palestinian people. We do not support the war crimes in Gaza and call for a free Palestine. This fundraiser event is working to raise awareness and fund Amplify Gaza's Community Resilience Project. Description: This workshop will be run by experienced women's health Physiotherapist, Becky Aston, Female Movement Specialist Niamh and Helen Buckingham, Pre and Postnatal Exercise Specialist. Venue: Crossfit Verulamium, St Albans. This workshop will: Educate you about the core & pelvic floor complex. Highlight risk factors in poor pelvic floor function associated with lifting & exercising, particularly lifting heavy weights and for impact movements. Help you identify patterns of function & dysfunction of the pelvic floor. Help you understand & manage your pelvic floor symptoms. Teach you how to engage the right muscles & use your breath to support your body in high-demand situations such as carrying heavy loads, running and lifting weights. You will then have the opport to practice these new skills during a female-only CrossFit class.
Title: Lifting, Exercise & Your Pelvic Floor - a Workshop
Subtitle: Join us to learn about the pelvic floor, symptom management  and how to engage your pelvic floor when it matters most.

Refund_Policy: Refunds up to 1 day before event
Description: No refunds will be given on unattended bookings  No rescheduling of bookings unless 24hrs notice is given before the session start time All children must be supervised by an adult over 18 years old Socks must be worn at all times and can be bought at the desk for ¬£1.00 a pair Entry cost is per session Our session times: Off Peak (Term Time only) Monday - Friday  10.30am - 12.30pm,  1.00pm - 3.00pm, 3.30pm - 5.30pm. Saturday - 10.30am - 11.30am, 12.00pm - 1.00pm, 1.30pm - 2.30pm, 3.00pm - 4.00pm, 4.30pm - 5.30pm Sunday - 11.00am - 12.00pm, 12.30pm - 1.30pm, 2.00pm - 3.00pm, 3.30pm - 4.30pm Peak (School & Public Holidays) Monday - Saturday 10.30am - 11.30am, 12.00pm - 1.00pm, 1.30pm - 2.30pm, 3.00pm - 4.00pm, 4.30pm - 5.30pm Sunday - 11.00am - 12.00pm, 12.30pm - 1.30pm, 2.00pm - 3.00pm, 3.30pm - 4.30pm Please arrive approx. 10 minutes before your session start time and have your QR code on your ticket ready to be scanned so we can get you in quicker and ensure you get your full playtime.
Title: Get Wild!
Subtitle: Get Wild!  an assortment of slides, tunnels, rope walks, climbing frames and much, much more! Fun and excitement guaranteed

Refund_Policy: Contact the organiser to request a refund.
Description: This event by Unified Dating offers a relaxed and friendly way to easily meet new people locally. If for any reason the event that you want to book onto says Sales Ended please email us at customercare@unifieddating.com stating the event that you want to book onto and date so that we can check and confirm if it is possible for you to book on. If the Venue Name and Address are not on the event page then at the latest we will add this to the event page by 2 hours prior to the event start time. At that point you will then be able to see the Venue Name and Address on the event page if we have not added it prior to this. Bored of swiping on dating apps? Want to meet someone new? Stop swiping and start dating! We know what makes a great party and we‚Äôve designed our events to help people make the most of the night. The event will be with people single and ready to mingle. It really is that simple! Dress code: Dress to impress/smart casual/ be yourself! If the event has sold out, please add yourself to the waitlist or email us to be added to the waitlist as more places may become available. To register with Unified Dating please visit: https://www.unifieddating.com/ Book your ticket, arrive at the venue, introduce yourself to everyone, get a drink and easily meet new people in your area!. Bring A Friend: You can book tickets for friends at 50% off using code BringAFriend at checkout. You will need to ensure at least one ticket is booked at full price in order to bring friends at up to 50% off. Enter the code in the promo code section at checkout and click apply to then scroll and select the 50% off Bring A Friend tickets. Please note Bring A Friend tickets are for people that are single and looking to participate in the event. Please note this event is a brunch event and attendees are expected to order from the brunch/ food menus. Please note the ticket price is simply to book on to attend this event. Any drinks or food you will need to purchase directly from the venue. You must not bring any food or drinks from outside into the venue. We cannot guarantee the availability of food or drinks. *Our events are for mixed ages. Our minimum age requirement is that attendees must be 18+ to book on and attend our events. *All attendees are required to have purchased a ticket for our events online prior to attending our events. We only sell our tickets online. We do not sell tickets at the event. Event Organiser: Unified Dating *Please note: Refund Policy: No Refunds. Additionally, we cannot guarantee the number or gender mix and do not offer refunds if some attendees fail to attend or the numbers are low or the gender mix skewed. As stated on this event page, order form and in our Terms and Conditions of Business we have a no refunds policy. We can offer an event credit if a valid reason is provided.  *Unified Dating has a zero tolerance policy towards any form of discrimination. News: Get Me Pampered has partnered with us to offer our customers 20% off on bookings!. Get Me Pampered offer hair, beauty and massage treatments at your home, hotel or office in London Zones 1 to 5 and Oxford, in other UK areas can also be offered at request. Find out more and to book for yourself, a group pamper party/ special event or as a gift: getmepampered.com. Use code GET20%OFF for 20% off at checkout on Get Me Pampered for bookings.

Subtitle: Book your place on this offline in-person brunch event and easily connect with new people in your area!

Description: South London every weekend, there's always something to do ü•≥ Get ready for non-stop vibes and unforgettable weekends in Clapham with the hottest mix of Hip-Hop, RnB, Afrobeats, and Bashment üå¥ The best party venue in Clapham is hosting the biggest and baddest parties EVER! every Friday and Saturday! Get ready and join 100s of people for the CRAZIEST Party of 2023 with your favourite DJs playing the best in Hip-Hop, RnB, Afrobeats, Bashment EVERY Weekend!  All genres will be played Contact: Info@WhatsTheMotiveUK.com Number: 07799084645 Dress code: Smart Casual (No Hats / No Hoods) 18+ID NO ID. NO ENTRY. NO EXCEPTIONS. Socials IÔªønstagram: Instagram.com/WhatsTheMotiveUK TERMS & CONDITIONS FOR TICKET PURCHASES Doors close at 1AM sharp. No Excuses or Exceptions. Please leave with the intention of arriving on time. Queuing times will be extremely long. Please factor this into your travelling time. No refunds under any circumstances outside of event cancellation. Date and location subject to change, we will not refund tickets if you do not want to attend the new location. If 10 days before the event, please note if you have any symptoms we will be unable to take your booking however if you have already purchased a ticket / or have a reservation, we will be able to rebook you for a future date On arrival at the venue, please bring your e-mail confirmation and ID (Passport, driving license, or any GOV-approved ID) Attractions subject to immediate change.
